member.name: T:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper
member.summary: Configure the arm reactions in shot.

member.name: M:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.#ctor(GTA.Ped)
member.summary: Creates a new Instance of the ShotConfigureArmsHelper for sending a ShotConfigureArms to a given .
member.param: The to send the ShotConfigureArms to.
member.remarks: Configure the arm reactions in shot.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Brace
member.summary: Blind brace with arms if appropriate.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.PointGun
member.summary: Point gun if appropriate.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.UseArmsWindmill
member.summary: ArmsWindmill if going backwards fast enough.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.ReleaseWound
member.summary: Release wound if going sideways/forward fast enough. 0 = don't. 1 = only if bracing. 2 = any default arm reaction.
member.remarks: Default value = 1. Min value = 0. Max value = 2.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.ReachFalling
member.summary: Reach for wound when falling. 0 = false, 1 = true, 2 = once per shot performance.
member.remarks: Default value = 0. Min value = 0. Max value = 2.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.ReachFallingWithOneHand
member.summary: Force character to reach for wound with only one hand when falling or fallen. 0 = allow two-handed reach, 1 = left only if two-handed possible, 2 = right only if two-handed possible, 3 = one handed but automatic (allows switching of hands).
member.remarks: Default value = 3. Min value = 0. Max value = 3.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.ReachOnFloor
member.summary: ReachForWound when on floor - 0 = false, 1 = true, 2 = once per shot performance.
member.remarks: Default value = 0. Min value = 0. Max value = 2.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.AlwaysReachTime
member.summary: Inhibit arms brace for this amount of time after reachForWound has begun.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.AWSpeedMult
member.summary: For armsWindmill, multiplier on character speed - increase of speed of circling is proportional to character speed (max speed of circliing increase = 1.5). Eg. lowering the value increases the range of velocity that the 0-1.5 is applied over.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.AWRadiusMult
member.summary: For armsWindmill, multiplier on character speed - increase of radii is proportional to character speed (max radius increase = 0.45). E.g. lowering the value increases the range of velocity that the 0-0.45 is applied over.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.AWStiffnessAdd
member.summary: For armsWindmill, added arm stiffness ranges from 0 to AWStiffnessAdd.
member.remarks: Default value = 4.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.ReachWithOneHand
member.summary: Force character to reach for wound with only one hand. 0 = allow two-handed reach, 1 = left only if two-handed possible, 2 = right only if two-handed possible.
member.remarks: Default value = 0. Min value = 0. Max value = 2.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.AllowLeftPistolRFW
member.summary: Allow character to reach for wound with left hand if holding a pistol. It never will for a rifle. If pointGun is running this will only happen if the hand cannot point and pointGun:poseUnusedGunArm = false.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.AllowRightPistolRFW
member.summary: Allow character to reach for wound with right hand if holding a pistol. It never will for a rifle. If pointGun is running this will only happen if the hand cannot point and pointGun:poseUnusedGunArm = false.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.RfwWithPistol
member.summary: Override pointGun and reachForWound if desired if holding a pistol. It never will for a rifle.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2
member.summary: Type of reaction.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2Left
member.summary: Fling the left arm.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2Right
member.summary: Fling the right arm.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2OverrideStagger
member.summary: Override stagger arms even if staggerFall:m_upperBodyReaction = true.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2TimeBefore
member.summary: Time after hit that the fling will start (allows for a bit of loose arm movement from bullet impact.snap etc).
member.remarks: Default value = 0.1f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2Time
member.summary: Duration of the fling behavior.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2MStiffL
member.summary: Muscle stiffness of the left arm. If negative then uses the shots underlying muscle stiffness from controlStiffness (i.e. respects looseness).
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.5f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2MStiffR
member.summary: Muscle stiffness of the right arm. If negative then uses the shots underlying muscle stiffness from controlStiffness (i.e. respects looseness).
member.remarks: Default value = -1.0f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.5f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2RelaxTimeL
member.summary: Maximum time before the left arm relaxes in the fling. It will relax automatically when the arm has completed it's bent arm fling. This is what causes the arm to straighten.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2RelaxTimeR
member.summary: Maximum time before the right arm relaxes in the fling. It will relax automatically when the arm has completed it's bent arm fling. This is what causes the arm to straighten.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2AngleMinL
member.summary: Minimum fling angle for left arm. Fling angle is random in the range fling2AngleMin:fling2AngleMax. Angle of fling in radians measured from the body horizontal sideways from shoulder. Positive is up, 0 shoulder level, negative down.
member.remarks: Default value = -1.5f. Min value = -1.5f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2AngleMaxL
member.summary: Maximum fling angle for left arm.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = -1.5f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2AngleMinR
member.summary: Minimum fling angle for right arm.
member.remarks: Default value = -1.5f. Min value = -1.5f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2AngleMaxR
member.summary: Maximum fling angle for right arm.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = -1.5f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2LengthMinL
member.summary: Minimum left arm length. Arm length is random in the range fling2LengthMin:fling2LengthMax. Arm length maps one to one with elbow angle. These values are scaled internally for the female character.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = 0.3f. Max value = 0.6f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2LengthMaxL
member.summary: Maximum left arm length.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.6f. Min value = 0.3f. Max value = 0.6f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2LengthMinR
member.summary: Min right arm length.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = 0.3f. Max value = 0.6f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Fling2LengthMaxR
member.summary: Max right arm length.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.6f. Min value = 0.3f. Max value = 0.6f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.Bust
member.summary: Has the character got a bust. If so then cupBust (move bust reach targets below bust) or bustElbowLift and cupSize (stop upperArm penetrating bust and move bust targets to surface of bust) are implemented.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.BustElbowLift
member.summary: Lift the elbows up this much extra to avoid upper arm penetrating the bust (when target hits spine2 or spine3).
member.remarks: Default value = 0.7f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.CupSize
member.summary: Amount reach target to bust (spine2) will be offset forward by.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.1f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.ShotConfigureArmsHelper.CupBust
member.summary: All reach targets above or on the bust will cause a reach below the bust. (specifically moves spine3 and spine2 targets to spine1). BustElbowLift and cupSize are ignored.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: T:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper
member.summary: Clone of High Fall with a wider range of operating conditions.

member.name: M:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.#ctor(GTA.Ped)
member.summary: Creates a new Instance of the SmartFallHelper for sending a SmartFall to a given .
member.param: The to send the SmartFall to.
member.remarks: Clone of High Fall with a wider range of operating conditions.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.BodyStiffness
member.summary: Stiffness of body. Value feeds through to bodyBalance (synced with defaults), to armsWindmill (14 for this value at default ), legs pedal, head look and roll down stairs directly.
member.remarks: Default value = 11.0f. Min value = 6.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.Bodydamping
member.summary: The damping of the joints.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 3.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.Catchfalltime
member.summary: The length of time before the impact that the character transitions to the landing.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.CrashOrLandCutOff
member.summary: 0.52angle is 0.868 dot//A threshold for deciding how far away from upright the character needs to be before bailing out (going into a foetal) instead of trying to land (keeping stretched out). NB: never does bailout if ignorWorldCollisions true.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.9f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.PdStrength
member.summary: Strength of the controller to keep the character at angle aimAngleBase from vertical.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.PdDamping
member.summary: Damping multiplier of the controller to keep the character at angle aimAngleBase from vertical. The actual damping is pdDamping*pdStrength*constant*angVel.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 5.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ArmAngSpeed
member.summary: Arm circling speed in armWindMillAdaptive.
member.remarks: Default value = 7.9f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 20.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ArmAmplitude
member.summary: In armWindMillAdaptive.
member.remarks: Default value = 2.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ArmPhase
member.summary: In armWindMillAdaptive 3.1 opposite for stuntman. 1.0 old default. 0.0 in phase.
member.remarks: Default value = 3.1f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 6.3f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ArmBendElbows
member.summary: In armWindMillAdaptive bend the elbows as a function of armAngle. For stunt man true otherwise false.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.LegRadius
member.summary: Radius of legs on pedal.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.4f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 0.5f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.LegAngSpeed
member.summary: In pedal.
member.remarks: Default value = 7.9f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 15.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.LegAsymmetry
member.summary: 0.0 for stunt man. Random offset applied per leg to the angular speed to desynchronize the pedaling - set to 0 to disable, otherwise should be set to less than the angularSpeed value.
member.remarks: Default value = 4.0f. Min value = -10.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.Arms2LegsPhase
member.summary: Phase angle between the arms and legs circling angle.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 6.5f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.Arms2LegsSync
member.summary: Syncs the arms angle to what the leg angle is.
member.remarks: Default value = . All speed/direction parameters of armswindmill are overwritten if = . If and you want synced arms/legs then armAngSpeed=legAngSpeed, legAsymmetry = 0.0 (to stop randomizations of the leg cicle speed).

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ArmsUp
member.summary: Where to put the arms when preparing to land. Approx 1 = above head, 0 = head height, -1 = down. LT -2.0 use catchFall arms, LT -3.0 use prepare for landing pose if Agent is due to land vertically, feet first.
member.remarks: Default value = -3.1f. Min value = -4.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.OrientateBodyToFallDirection
member.summary: Toggle to orientate to fall direction. i.e. orientate so that the character faces the horizontal velocity direction.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.OrientateTwist
member.summary: If false don't worry about the twist angle of the character when orientating the character. If false this allows the twist axis of the character to be free (You can get a nice twisting highFall like the one in dieHard 4 when the car goes into the helicopter).
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.OrientateMax
member.summary: DEVEL parameter - suggest you don't edit it. Maximum torque the orientation controller can apply. If 0 then no helper torques will be used. 300 will orientate the character softly for all but extreme angles away from aimAngleBase. If abs (current -aimAngleBase) is getting near 3.0 then this can be reduced to give a softer feel.
member.remarks: Default value = 300.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2000.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.AlanRickman
member.summary: If true then orientate the character to face the point from where it started falling. High fall like the one in "Die Hard" with Alan Rickman.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.FowardRoll
member.summary: Try to execute a forward Roll on landing.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.UseZeroPose_withFowardRoll
member.summary: Blend to a zero pose when forward roll is attempted.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.AimAngleBase
member.summary: Angle from vertical the pdController is driving to (positive = forwards).
member.remarks: Default value = 0.2f. Min value = -3.1f. Max value = 3.1f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.FowardVelRotation
member.summary: Scale to add/subtract from aimAngle based on forward speed (Internal).
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.FootVelCompScale
member.summary: Scale to change to amount of vel that is added to the foot ik from the velocity (Internal).
member.remarks: Default value = 0.1f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.SideD
member.summary: Sideoffset for the feet during prepareForLanding. +ve = right.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.2f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.FowardOffsetOfLegIK
member.summary: Forward offset for the feet during prepareForLanding.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.LegL
member.summary: Leg Length for ik (Internal)//unused.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.CatchFallCutOff
member.summary: 0.5angle is 0.878 dot. Cutoff to go to the catchFall (internal) //mmmtodo do like crashOrLandCutOff.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.9f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.LegStrength
member.summary: Strength of the legs at landing.
member.remarks: Default value = 12.0f. Min value = 6.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.Balance
member.summary: If true have enough strength to balance. If false not enough strength in legs to balance (even though bodyBlance called).
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.IgnorWorldCollisions
member.summary: Never go into bailout (foetal).
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.AdaptiveCircling
member.summary: Stunt man type fall. Arm and legs circling direction controlled by angmom and orientation.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.Hula
member.summary: With stunt man type fall. Hula reaction if can't see floor and not rotating fast.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.MaxSpeedForRecoverableFall
member.summary: Character needs to be moving less than this speed to consider fall as a recoverable one.
member.remarks: Default value = 15.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 100.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.MinSpeedForBrace
member.summary: Character needs to be moving at least this fast horizontally to start bracing for impact if there is an object along its trajectory.
member.remarks: Default value = 10.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 100.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.LandingNormal
member.summary: Ray-cast normal doted with up direction has to be greater than this number to consider object flat enough to land on it.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.6f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.RdsForceMag
member.remarks: Default value = 0.8f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.RdsTargetLinVeDecayTime
member.summary: RDS: Time for the targetlinearVelocity to decay to zero.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.RdsTargetLinearVelocity
member.summary: RDS: Helper torques are applied to match the spin of the character to the max of targetLinearVelocity and COMVelMag. -1 to use initial character velocity.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 30.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.RdsUseStartingFriction
member.summary: Start Catch Fall/RDS state with specified friction. Catch fall will overwrite based on setFallingReaction.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.RdsStartingFriction
member.summary: Catch Fall/RDS starting friction. Catch fall will overwrite based on setFallingReaction.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.RdsStartingFrictionMin
member.summary: Catch Fall/RDS starting friction minimum. Catch fall will overwrite based on setFallingReaction.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.RdsForceVelThreshold
member.summary: Velocity threshold under which RDS force mag will be applied.
member.remarks: Default value = 10.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 100.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.InitialState
member.summary: Force initial state (used in vehicle bail out to start SF_CatchFall (6) earlier.
member.remarks: Default value = 0. Min value = 0. Max value = 7.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ChangeExtremityFriction
member.summary: Allow friction changes to be applied to the hands and feet.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.Teeter
member.summary: Set up an immediate teeter in the direction of trave if initial state is SF_Balance.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.TeeterOffset
member.summary: Offset the default Teeter edge in the direction of travel. Will need to be tweaked depending on how close to the real edge AI tends to trigger the behavior.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.StopRollingTime
member.summary: Time in seconds before ped should start actively trying to stop rolling.
member.remarks: Default value = 2.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 100.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ReboundScale
member.summary: Scale for rebound assistance. 0 = off, 1 = very bouncy, 2 = jbone crazy.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ReboundMask
member.summary: Part mask to apply rebound assistance.
member.remarks: Default value = uk.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.ForceHeadAvoid
member.summary: Force head avoid to be active during Catch Fall even when character is not on the ground.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.CfZAxisSpinReduction
member.summary: Pass-through parameter for Catch Fall spin reduction. Increase to stop more spin. 0..1.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.SplatWhenStopped
member.summary: Transition to splat state when com vel is below value, regardless of character health or fall velocity. Set to zero to disable.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 100.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.BlendHeadWhenStopped
member.summary: Blend head to neutral pose com vel approaches zero. Linear between zero and value. Set to zero to disable.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 100.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.SmartFallHelper.SpreadLegs
member.summary: Spread legs amount for pedal during fall.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.1f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: M:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.#ctor(GTA.Ped)
member.summary: Creates a new Instance of the StaggerFallHelper for sending a StaggerFall to a given .
member.param: The to send the StaggerFall to.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.ArmStiffness

member.remarks: Default value = 12.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.ArmDamping
member.summary: Sets damping value for the arms.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.SpineDamping

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.SpineStiffness
member.remarks: Default value = 10.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.ArmStiffnessStart
member.summary: ArmStiffness during the yanked timescale i.e. timeAtStartValues.
member.remarks: Default value = 3.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.ArmDampingStart
member.summary: ArmDamping during the yanked timescale i.e. timeAtStartValues.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.1f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.SpineDampingStart
member.summary: SpineDamping during the yanked timescale i.e. timeAtStartValues.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.1f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.SpineStiffnessStart
member.summary: SpineStiffness during the yanked timescale i.e. timeAtStartValues.
member.remarks: Default value = 3.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.TimeAtStartValues
member.summary: Time spent with Start values for arms and spine stiffness and damping i.e. for whiplash effect.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.RampTimeFromStartValues
member.summary: Time spent ramping from Start to end values for arms and spine stiffness and damping i.e. for whiplash effect (occurs after timeAtStartValues).
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.StaggerStepProb
member.summary: Probability per step of time spent in a stagger step.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.StepsTillStartEnd
member.summary: Steps taken before lowerBodyStiffness starts ramping down by perStepReduction1.
member.remarks: Default value = 2. Min value = 0. Max value = 100.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.TimeStartEnd
member.summary: Time from start of behavior before lowerBodyStiffness starts ramping down for rampTimeToEndValues to endValues.
member.remarks: Default value = 100.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 100.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.RampTimeToEndValues
member.summary: Time spent ramping from lowerBodyStiffness to lowerBodyStiffnessEnd.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.LowerBodyStiffness
member.summary: LowerBodyStiffness should be 12.
member.remarks: Default value = 13.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.LowerBodyStiffnessEnd
member.summary: LowerBodyStiffness at end.
member.remarks: Default value = 8.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.PredictionTime
member.summary: Amount of time (seconds) into the future that the character tries to step to. Bigger values try to recover with fewer, bigger steps. Smaller values recover with smaller steps, and generally recover less.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.1f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.PerStepReduction1
member.summary: LowerBody stiffness will be reduced every step to make the character fallover.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.7f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.LeanInDirRate
member.summary: LeanInDirection will be increased from 0 to leanInDirMax linearly at this rate.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.LeanInDirMaxF
member.summary: Max of leanInDirection magnitude when going forwards.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.1f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.LeanInDirMaxB
member.summary: Max of leanInDirection magnitude when going backwards.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.LeanHipsMaxF
member.summary: Max of leanInDirectionHips magnitude when going forwards.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.LeanHipsMaxB
member.summary: Max of leanInDirectionHips magnitude when going backwards.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.Lean2multF
member.summary: Lean of spine to side in side velocity direction when going forwards.
member.remarks: Default value = -1.0f. Min value = -5.0f. Max value = 5.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.Lean2multB
member.summary: Lean of spine to side in side velocity direction when going backwards.
member.remarks: Default value = -2.0f. Min value = -5.0f. Max value = 5.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.PushOffDist
member.summary: Amount stance foot is behind com in the direction of velocity before the leg tries to pushOff to increase momentum. Increase to lower the probability of the pushOff making the character bouncy.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.2f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.MaxPushoffVel
member.summary: Stance leg will only pushOff to increase momentum if the vertical hip velocity is less than this value. 0.4 seems like a good value. The higher it is the less this functionality is applied. If it is very low or negative this can stop the pushOff altogether.
member.remarks: Default value = 20.0f. Min value = -20.0f. Max value = 20.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.HipBendMult
member.summary: HipBend scaled with velocity.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = -10.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.AlwaysBendForwards
member.summary: Bend forwards at the hip (hipBendMult) whether moving backwards or forwards.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.SpineBendMult
member.summary: Spine bend scaled with velocity.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.4f. Min value = -10.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.UseHeadLook
member.summary: Enable and provide a look-at target to make the character's head turn to face it while balancing, balancer default is 0.2.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.HeadLookPos
member.summary: Position of thing to look at.
member.remarks: Default value = Vector3(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f).

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.HeadLookInstanceIndex
member.summary: Level index of thing to look at.
member.remarks: Default value = -1. Min value = -1.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.HeadLookAtVelProb
member.summary: Probability [0-1] that headLook will be looking in the direction of velocity when stepping.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.TurnOffProb
member.summary: Weighted probability that turn will be off. This is one of six turn type weights.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.Turn2TargetProb
member.summary: Weighted probability of turning towards headLook target. This is one of six turn type weights.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.Turn2VelProb
member.summary: Weighted probability of turning towards velocity. This is one of six turn type weights.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.TurnAwayProb
member.summary: Weighted probability of turning away from headLook target. This is one of six turn type weights.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.TurnLeftProb
member.summary: Weighted probability of turning left. This is one of six turn type weights.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.TurnRightProb
member.summary: Weighted probability of turning right. This is one of six turn type weights.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.UseBodyTurn
member.summary: Enable and provide a positive bodyTurnTimeout and provide a look-at target to make the character turn to face it while balancing.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.StaggerFallHelper.UpperBodyReaction
member.summary: Enable upper body reaction i.e. blindBrace and armswindmill.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: M:GTA.NaturalMotion.TeeterHelper.#ctor(GTA.Ped)
member.summary: Creates a new Instance of the TeeterHelper for sending a Teeter to a given .

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.TeeterHelper.EdgeLeft
member.summary: Defines the left edge point (left of character facing edge).
member.remarks: Default value = Vector3(39.5f, 38.9f, 21.1f). Min value = 0.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.TeeterHelper.EdgeRight
member.summary: Defines the right edge point (right of character facing edge).
member.remarks: Default value = Vector3(39.5f, 39.9f, 21.1f). Min value = 0.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.TeeterHelper.UseExclusionZone
member.summary: Stop stepping across the line defined by edgeLeft and edgeRight.
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.TeeterHelper.UseHeadLook
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.TeeterHelper.CallHighFall
member.summary: Call highFall if fallen over the edge. If false just call blended writhe (to go over the top of the fall behavior of the underlying behavior e.g. bodyBalance).
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.TeeterHelper.LeanAway
member.summary: Lean away from the edge based on velocity towards the edge (if closer than 2m from edge).
member.remarks: Default value = True.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.TeeterHelper.PreTeeterTime
member.summary: Time-to-edge threshold to start pre-teeter (windmilling, etc).
member.remarks: Default value = 2.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.TeeterHelper.LeanAwayTime
member.summary: Time-to-edge threshold to start leaning away from a potential fall.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.TeeterHelper.LeanAwayScale
member.summary: Scales stay upright lean and hip pitch.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.TeeterHelper.TeeterTime
member.summary: Time-to-edge threshold to start full-on teeter (more aggressive lean, drop-and-twist, etc).
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.summary: Toggle to Use the Left arm.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.UpperBodyFlinchHelper.HeadLookAwayFromTarget
member.summary: Look away from target (unless protecting head then look between feet).

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.UpperBodyFlinchHelper.UseHeadLook
member.summary: Use headlook.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.UpperBodyFlinchHelper.TurnTowards

member.remarks: Default value = 0.6f. Min value = -0.1f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.TurnThresholdMax
member.summary: Max angle at which the turn with toggle to the other direction (actual toggle angle is chosen randomly in range min to max). If it is 1 then it will never toggle. If negative then no turn is applied.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.6f. Min value = -0.1f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.UseHeadLook
member.summary: Enable and provide a look-at target to make the character's head turn to face it while balancing.
member.remarks: Default value = False.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.HeadLookPos
member.summary: Position of thing to look at.
member.remarks: Default value = Vector3(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f).

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.HeadLookInstanceIndex
member.summary: Level index of thing to look at.
member.remarks: Default value = -1. Min value = -1.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.HeadLookAtVelProb
member.summary: Probability [0-1] that headLook will be looking in the direction of velocity when stepping.
member.remarks: Default value = -1.0f. Min value = -1.0f. Max value = 1.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.ComVelRDSThresh
member.summary: For handsAndKnees catchfall ONLY: comVel above which rollDownstairs will start.
member.remarks: Default value = 2.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 20.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.HulaPeriod
member.summary: 0.25 A complete wiggle will take 4*hulaPeriod.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.HipAmplitude
member.summary: Amount of hip movement.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 4.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.SpineAmplitude
member.summary: Amount of spine movement.
member.remarks: Default value = 1.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 4.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.MinRelaxPeriod
member.summary: Wriggle relaxes for a minimum of minRelaxPeriod (if it is negative it is a multiplier on the time previously spent wriggling).
member.remarks: Default value = 0.3f. Min value = -5.0f. Max value = 5.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.MaxRelaxPeriod
member.summary: Wriggle relaxes for a maximum of maxRelaxPeriod (if it is negative it is a multiplier on the time previously spent wriggling).
member.remarks: Default value = 1.5f. Min value = -5.0f. Max value = 5.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.RollHelp
member.summary: Amount of cheat torque applied to turn the character over.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.GroundLegStiffness
member.summary: Leg Stiffness when on the ground.
member.remarks: Default value = 11.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.GroundArmStiffness
member.summary: Arm Stiffness when on the ground.
member.remarks: Default value = 11.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.GroundSpineStiffness
member.summary: Spine Stiffness when on the ground.
member.remarks: Default value = 14.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 16.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.GroundLegDamping
member.summary: Leg Damping when on the ground.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.GroundArmDamping
member.summary: Arm Damping when on the ground.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.GroundSpineDamping
member.summary: Spine Damping when on the ground.
member.remarks: Default value = 0.5f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 2.0f.

member.name: P:GTA.NaturalMotion.YankedHelper.GroundFriction
member.summary: Friction multiplier on body parts when on ground. Character can look too slidy with groundFriction = 1. Higher values give a more jerky reaction but this seems timestep dependent especially for dragged by the feet.
member.remarks: Default value = 8.0f. Min value = 0.0f. Max value = 10.0f.

member.summary: Stops this behavior on the given .

member.name: M:GTA.NaturalMotion.Message.SendTo(GTA.Ped)
member.summary: Sends the message for this behavior to the given . Will not start it unless the "start" argument is set. Starts a CTaskNMControl task if the has no such task and loops it until manually aborted.
member.param: The to send the to.
member.remarks: Although it is technically possible to send NM messages to peds that are running a NM task other than CTaskNMControl without starting a CTaskNMControl task, this method will always start a CTaskNMControl task.

member.name: M:GTA.NaturalMotion.Message.SendTo(GTA.Ped,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts this behavior on the given for a specified duration. Always starts a new ragdoll task, making it impossible to stack multiple behaviors on the .

How long to apply the behavior for (-1 for looped).

member.name: T:GTA.UI.Font
member.summary: An enumeration of all the font styles that script text draw commands support.

summary.para: This font is for the standard font.

Chalet London 1960 by House Industries will be used when the game language is set to a non-CJK language. The game will use an alternative standard font that contains appropriate CJK characters when the game language is set to a CJK language.
This font is for the cursive font.

Sign Painter House Brush by House Industries will be used when the game language is set to a non-CJK language. The standard font, which is the same as , will be used when the game language is set to a CJK language unless the player have custom font files installed.
This font contains upper ASCII characters and some other shapes for crew tags in GTA Online.
This font style has a subset of the glyphs of unless the player have custom font files installed.
This font contains only Chevron arrows, some shield symbols, and hexagons.

This font is for the condensed font for gamer tags or the distance info on the radar. You should use if you want to draw strings with condensed font if possible but they can contain some CJK characters (e.g. localized strings from gxt files).

The native functions for text drawing will use the condensed font Chalet Comprim Cologne 1960 regardless of the game language setting. The natives will draw strings that contain only non-CJK characters without any trouble, but without having custom font files installed, the natives will draw rectangles (a.k.a. tofus) instead of CJK characters because Chalet Comprim Cologne 1960 doesn't contain any CJK characters.
This font style specifies the same font unless the player have custom font files installed.
This font contains only glyphs of numbers (0 to 9), dollar sign, asterisk, plus sign, colon, semicolon, equals sign, slash, and backslash in ASCII.
This font style has a subset of the glyphs of unless the player have custom font files installed.
This font is for the condensed font for generic uses. Consider using instead when the texts you want to draw does not contain any CJK characters.

The native functions for text drawing will use the condensed font Chalet Comprim Cologne 1960 when the game language is set to a non-CJK language. When the game language is set to a CJK language, they will use the standard font, which is the same as (unless the player have custom font files installed).

member.name: F:GTA.UI.Font.Pricedown
member.summary: Pricedown will be used when the game language is set to a non-CJK language. The standard font, which is the same as , will be used when the game language is set to a CJK language unless the player have custom font files installed.

member.name: F:GTA.UI.Font.Taxi
member.summary: The font for taxi will be used when the game language is set to a non-CJK language. The font does contain invisible glyphs for lower characters. The standard font, which is the same as , will be used when the game language is set to a CJK language unless the player have custom font files installed.

member.name: T:GTA.AtHashValue
member.summary: Represents a jenkins-one-at-a-time hash value for common cases. Can be directly passed as an argument of native functions via .
member.remarks:
The following conversions are supposed to be performed before hashing the original string:
Map ASCII uppercase letters to lowercase.
Extract the substring within the first two double quotes if the first character/byte is a double quote (hashes to the end of sequence if there is only one double quote).
Convert backslashes to forward slashes so that the has is more useful for filenames.

member.name: P:GTA.AtHashValue.Null
member.summary: Gets the null value of , whose hash is zero.

member.name: P:GTA.AtHashValue.IsNull
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether this instance is the null , whose hash is zero.

member.name: M:GTA.AtHashValue.FromString(System.String)
member.summary: Computes an from a that contains only ASCII characters.
member.param: A that contains only ASCII characters.
member.returns: An that contains the calculated hash.
member.remarks: This method only expects ASCII characters in . This is because the lookup table used by the joaat hash function used in GET_HASH_KEY expects only ASCII characters, and the table contains values for non-ASCII characters only to guarantee correctness even if "weird" european characters "sneak in" (are included in the string). If you need to pass a string that contains non-ASCII characters, use instead.

member.summary: Computes an from an array of .
member.param: An array of .
member.returns: An that contains the calculated hash.

member.summary: Computes an from a . will be converted to a UTF-8 sequence before hashing. Uppercase letters and backslashes will be converted to lowercase letters and slashes respectively.
member.param: A to hash. Will be converted to a UTF-8 sequence before hashing.
member.returns: An that contains the calculated hash.

member.name: M:GTA.AtHashValue.ComputeHash(System.String)
member.summary: Computes a joaat hash as an from a that contains only ASCII characters.
member.param: A that contains only ASCII characters.
member.returns: The calculated joaat hash.
member.remarks: This method only expects ASCII characters in . This is because the lookup table used by the joaat hash function used in GET_HASH_KEY expects only ASCII characters, and the table contains values for non-ASCII characters only to guarantee correctness even if "weird" european characters "sneak in" (are included in the string). If you need to pass a string that contains non-ASCII characters, use instead.

member.name: M:GTA.AtHashValue.ComputeHash(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Computes a joaat hash from an array of .
member.param: An array of .
member.returns: The calculated joaat hash.

member.summary: Computes a joaat hash as an from a . Converts the string to UTF-8 (which the game uses for localized strings) before hashing.

member.name: M:GTA.Audio.GetSoundId
member.summary: Gets a instance of a triggered sound. This method returns a new , which is used for keeping track of sounds after they've been triggered - use this if you need to control a sound after it's been started, for instance to stop a looping sound, or to change a sound's pitch midway through playback.

remarks.para: SoundIds can be reused, without needing to release them and grab a new one. If a sound's finished playing, you can reuse its to kick off another one. If the sound's not finished playing, it'll be stopped first (fading out or whatever is set up in RAVE by the sound designer), and the new one kicked off; usually it is safer to just get a new .
Scripted sound can be reserved up to 100 in the audScriptAudioEntity instance. The limit is shared among all scripts.

member.returns: A instance with the assigned id in the range of from 0 to 100 if the method successfully found a free id/index; otherwise, .

members.member:
Plays back a sound with the name , but do not track of sounds. If this is used to play a sound for which no pan or speakermask is set by the sound designer, then the sound will play from the map's origin - therefore this should only be used to play frontend sounds like menu bleeps or other artificially panned effects.
The sound name to play. The optional sound set name that contains the sound. .

Plays back a sound "frontend" - at full volume, panned centrally, but do not track of sounds.
The sound name to play. The optional sound set name that contains the sound. .
If the sound has a Pan or a SpeakerMask set by the sound designer then the it will play using these settings, otherwise it will play from dead ahead (0).

member.name: M:GTA.Camera.Create(GTA.ScriptedCameraNameHash,GTA.Math.Vector3,GTA.Math.Vector3,System.Single,System.Boolean,GTA.EulerRotationOrder)
member.summary: Creates a scripted of a given name hash.
member.param: The camera name hash. Passing a invalid name hash will result in the return value. It would result in some unintended behaviors such as the camera position not being able to change if you pass a camera name hash whose metadata is not designed for scripted cameras.
The position of the camera.
The rotation of the camera.
The field of view of the camera.
If , the created camera will be activated upon creation.
The rotation order in world space.
member.returns: A new instance if the method successfully created a new ; otherwise, .
member.remarks: The method will fail to create a scripted if the passed camera name is invalid or the camera pool is full. The method will return in said conditions.

The position of the camera.
The rotation of the camera.
The field of view of the camera.
If , the created camera will be activated upon creation.
The rotation order in world space.
member.returns: A new instance if the method successfully created a new ; otherwise, .
member.remarks: The method will fail to create a scripted if the passed camera name is invalid or the camera pool is full. The method will return in said conditions.

member.name: M:GTA.Camera.InterpolateToNewCamFrame(GTA.Math.Vector3,GTA.Math.Vector3,System.Single,System.UInt32,GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType,GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType,GTA.EulerRotationOrder)
member.summary: Interpolates this to a cam frame consisted of specified camera frame parameters. The must be active for this method to work, or it will not interpolate (unless is zero).
member.param: The target position.
The target rotation.
The target field of view.

The duration of the interpolation in milliseconds. Setting to zero will make the method set the cam frame parameters immediately as how
works.
The camera graph type for position transition.
The camera graph type for rotation transition.
The rotation order in world space.
member.remarks: This method fails to interpolate if there is no space for a new camera so the method cannot add a new camera cloned from this camera, which gets deleted on completion of the interpolation (unless is zero). The camera will be deactivated if this method successfully starts an camera interpolation.

The additional offset to be applied from the attach position.

member.summary: Plays a camera animation on this .

The position of the origin in world coordinates to playback the anim from. Any local scene origin/offset specified in the animation clip will be applied in addition to this.

The animation flags to be used for playback.
The rotation order to be used when composing a matrix from the Euler angles specified in .
member.returns: if the method successfully starts the animation; otherwise, .
member.remarks: The must have been created using the camera name hash or the camera name `DEFAULT_ANIMATED_CAMERA` (both specify the same camera metadata). Otherwise, the method will fail to start the animation.

member.name: T:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType
member.summary: An enumeration of all the curve types of camera frame interpolation, where the enum members specify how to scale base blend level (from 0f to 1f) of a camera frame interpolator. Corresponds to what camFrameInterpolator::eCurveTypes in the game code defines.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.Linear
member.summary: Does not scale the blend Level.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.SinAccelDecel
member.summary: The interpolator works the same with this type as how they works with .

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.Accel
member.summary: The interpolator works the same with this type as how they works with .

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.Decel
member.summary: The interpolator works the same with this type as how they works with .

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.SlowIn
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the sine ease-in curve function once.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.SlowOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the sine ease-out curve function once.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.SlowInOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the sine ease-in-out curve function once.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.VerySlowIn
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the sine ease-in curve function twice.
member.remarks: See the remarks of to view how the sign ease-in function can be defined.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.VerySlowOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the sine ease-out curve function twice.
member.remarks: See the remarks of to view how the sign ease-out function can be defined.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.VerySlowInSlowOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the sine ease-in-out curve function once then applying the sine ease-in curve function once.
member.remarks: See the remarks tags of and to view how the sine ease-in-out and sign-in function can be defined respectively.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.SlowInVerySlowOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the sine ease-in-out curve function once then applying the sine ease-out curve function once.
member.remarks: See the remarks tags of and to view how the sine ease-in-out and sign ease-out function can be defined respectively.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.VerySlowInVerySlowOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the sine ease-in-out curve function twice.
member.remarks: See the remarks tags of to view how the sine ease-in-out function can be defined.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.QuadraticEaseIn
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the quadratic ease-in curve function once.
member.remarks: The quadratic ease-in function can be defined like `var QuadraticEaseIn = (float t) => t * t;`, in the range of [0f, 1f].

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.QuadraticEaseOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the quadratic ease-in-out curve function once.
member.remarks: The quadratic ease-out function can be defined like `var QuadraticEaseOut = (float t) => 1.0f - QuadraticEaseIn(1.0f - t);`, in the range of [0f, 1f].

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.QuadraticEaseInOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the quadratic ease-in-out curve function once.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.CubicEaseIn
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the cubic ease-in curve function once.
member.remarks: The cubic ease-in function can be defined like `var CubicEaseIn = (float t) => t * t * t;`, in the range of [0f, 1f].

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.CubicEaseOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the cubic ease-in-out curve function once.
member.remarks: The cubic ease-out function can be defined like `var CubicEaseOut = (float t) => 1.0f - CubicEaseIn(1.0f - t);`, in the range of [0f, 1f].

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.CubicEaseInOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the cubic ease-in-out curve function once.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.QuarticEaseIn
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the quartic ease-in curve function once.
member.remarks: The quartic ease-in function can be defined like `var QuarticEaseIn = (float t) => t * t * t * t;`, in the range of [0f, 1f].

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.QuarticEaseOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the quartic ease-in-out curve function once.
member.remarks: The quartic ease-out function can be defined like `var QuarticEaseOut = (float t) => 1.0f - QuarticEaseIn(1.0f - t);`, in the range of [0f, 1f].

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.QuarticEaseInOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the quartic ease-in-out curve function once.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.QuinticEaseIn
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the quintic ease-in curve function once.
member.remarks: The quintic ease-in function can be defined like `var QuinticEaseIn = (float t) => t * t * t * t * t;`, in the range of [0f, 1f].

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.QuinticEaseOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the quintic ease-in-out curve function once.
member.remarks: The quintic ease-out function can be defined like `var QuinticEaseOut = (float t) => 1.0f - QuinticEaseIn(1.0f - t);`, in the range of [0f, 1f].

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.QuinticEaseInOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the quintic ease-in-out curve function once.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.CircularEaseIn
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the circular ease-in curve function once.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.CircularEaseOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the circular ease-out curve function once.

member.name: F:GTA.CamFrameInterpolatorCurveType.CircularEaseInOut
member.summary: The interpolator scales the blend Level for lerping by applying the circular ease-in-out curve function once.

member.name: F:GTA.CamInVehicleState.EnteringVehicle
member.summary: Gameplay camera in interpolating to the follow vehicle camera.

member.name: F:GTA.CamInVehicleState.InsideVehicle
member.summary: Gameplay camera is running the follow vehicle camera.

member.name: F:GTA.CamInVehicleState.ExitingVehicle
member.summary: Gameplay camera is interpolating from the follow vehicle camera to the follow ped camera.

member.name: F:GTA.CamInVehicleState.OutsideVehicle
member.summary: Gameplay camera is fully running the follow ped camera, do not need to specify a when specifying this value.

member.name: T:GTA.CamSplineSmoothingMode
member.summary: An enumeration of camera spline smoothing mode.

member.name: F:GTA.CamSplineSmoothingMode.NoSmooth
member.summary: No smoothing just moves at a constant rate.

member.name: F:GTA.CamSplineSmoothingMode.SlowInSmooth
member.summary: Decelerates when approaching a node.

member.name: F:GTA.CamSplineSmoothingMode.SlowOutSmooth
member.summary: Accelerates slowly when leaving a node.

member.name: F:GTA.CamSplineSmoothingMode.SlowInOutSmooth

member.name: T:GTA.ScriptCameraDirector
member.summary: Represents the script camera director (camScriptDirector in the exe). The script camera director is responsible for managing scripted cameras.

member.name: P:GTA.ScriptCameraDirector.RenderingCam
member.summary: Gets the camera currently rendering to the game screen.
member.remarks: This property will return if no scripted camera is rendering to the game screen, where the current rendering camera (camBaseCamera) does not match any scripted cameras this scripted camera director (camScriptDirector) is managing.

member.name: M:GTA.ScriptCameraDirector.StartRendering
member.summary: Starts rendering a scripted camera without interpolation. Tells the game that script thread of the SHVDN runtime (GtaThread, not individual SHVDN scripts) wants to enable rendering of scripted cameras.

member.name: M:GTA.ScriptCameraDirector.StartRenderingWithInterp(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts rendering a scripted camera while interpolating from the gameplay camera that the gameplay camera director (camGameplayDirector) is using to a scripted camera. Tells the game that script thread of the SHVDN runtime (GtaThread, not individual SHVDN scripts) wants to enable rendering of scripted cameras.
member.param: The interpolation duration in milliseconds. If zero, this method will behave the same as and will not have effect.

member.name: M:GTA.ScriptCameraDirector.StopRendering(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stops rendering a scripted camera without interpolation. Tells the game that script thread of the SHVDN runtime (GtaThread, not individual SHVDN scripts) wants to disable rendering of scripted cameras.

member.name: M:GTA.ScriptCameraDirector.StopRenderingWithInterp(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stops rendering a scripted camera while interpolating from the previously rendered scripted camera to the gameplay camera that the gameplay camera director (camGameplayDirector) is using. Tells the game that script thread of the SHVDN runtime (GtaThread, not individual SHVDN scripts) wants to disable rendering of scripted cameras.
member.param: The interpolation duration in milliseconds. If zero, this method will behave the same as and will not have effect.

param.name: shouldLockInterpolationSourceFrame
param.para: If , the source camera frame is updated throughout the interpolation, allowing for fully dynamic interpolation that can reduce the appearance of 'lag' when the source frame is not static. For example, when the Z coordinates of the source scripted camera and a destination gameplay camera are the same at the time when the interpolation starts but the Z coordinate of the source scripted camera are added after the interpolation starts, that of the moving camera (frame) should be greater than that of the destination gameplay camera.
Does not have any effect if is zero.

member.param: If , a request to stop rendering will be enforced irrespective of whether other script threads (GtaThreads) expect rendering to be active. Note that this can result in conflicts between concurrent script threads, so this must be used with caution.
member.remarks: At least one of the scripts loaded by SHVDN must have created a that can be rendered, thus you would want to set to on your . Note that rendering is typically not stopped if other script threads (GtaThread) other than the SHVDN runtime still expect it to be active (see .)

member.name: M:GTA.ScriptCameraDirector.StopRenderingUsingCatchUp(System.Boolean,System.Single,GTA.CamSplineSmoothingMode)
member.summary: Stops rendering a scripted camera and force gameplay camera to blend from scripted camera to gameplay camera. Tells the game that script thread of the SHVDN runtime (GtaThread, not individual SHVDN scripts) wants to disable rendering of scripted cameras.
member.param: If , a request to stop rendering will be enforced irrespective of whether other script threads (GtaThreads) expect rendering to be active. Note that this can result in conflicts between concurrent script threads, so this must be used with caution.
Overrides the distance over which the catch up blend occurs in the (camGameplayDirector). If zero is specified, default blend distance will be used.
The blend type to use in the (camGameplayDirector).
member.remarks: At least one of the scripts loaded by SHVDN must have created a that can be rendered, so you would want to set to on your . Note that rendering is typically not stopped if another script thread (GtaThread) other than the SHVDN runtime still expects it to be active (see .)

member.name: P:GTA.ScriptCameraDirector.IsInterpolatingFromScriptCam
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether an interpolation is occuring from a script cam to a gameplay cam.
member.remarks: Returns if the interpolating state matches the specific value on the .

member.name: P:GTA.ScriptCameraDirector.IsInterpolatingToScriptCam
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether an interpolation is occurring to a script cam from a gameplay cam.
member.remarks: Returns if the interpolating state matches the specific value on the .

member.name: T:GTA.ClipSet
member.summary: Represents a dictionary struct for a clip/animation set, which should represent a key name for fwClipSet. Clip/Animation sets are defined in clip_sets.ymt (compiled file of clip_sets.pso.meta according to the official scripting headers) or clip_sets.xml files. Note that clip/animation sets are different from clip/animation dictionaries, which is created from ycd files (you can request clip sets with ).

member.summary: Computes the hash of in the same way as how the game calculates hashes for clip sets to store in the global rage::fwClipSetManager and as how calculates. May be useful when you want to get the identifier in the same way as how the game handles clip sets or when you investigate game memory to see how clip sets (rage::fwClipSet) are stored in the rage::fwClipSetManager.
member.returns: The hash value calculated from .

member.name: T:GTA.Control
member.summary: An enumeration of control input types.
member.remarks: The corresponding enum name in the exe is rage__InputType. The joaat hash value is 0xCE566A0F, where the original name is rage::InputType but ':' characters are replaced with '_'. You can find the enum name hash by searching for the hash value in the exe.

member.name: T:GTA.CrClipAsset
member.summary: Represents a struct that contains a and a animation clip name so you can find a animation clip (an instance of a subclass of rage::crClip, which is an abstract one).

remarks.para: This struct does not specify an target subclass out of all 3 subclasses rage::crClip, which are, rage::crClipAnimation, rage::crClipAnimations, and rage::crClipAnimationExpression (the one that is presumed to not be used), as the internal function fwAnimManager::GetClipIfExistsByDictIndex, which gets a rage::crClip by an index for a clip dictionary and an animation hash, does not distinguish animation types, and thus how animation natives accept any of rage::crClip subclasses.
You should not use the default constructor. The fallback behavior can be changed from filling in the 2 values with after the codebase of SHVDN starts to use C# 10 or later C# version.

member.name: P:GTA.CrClipAsset.ClipDictionary
member.summary: Gets the struct of clip/animation dictionary name.

member.name: P:GTA.CrClipAsset.ClipName
member.summary: Gets the clip name. Do not confuse with animation names, where a clip can contain multiple animations if the clip class is rage::crClipAnimations.

member.name: M:GTA.CrClipAsset.HashClipName
member.summary: Computes the hash of in the same way as how the game calculates hashes for clip names to store in a rage::crClipDictionary and as how calculates. May be useful when you want to get the identifier in the same way as how the game handles texture dictionaries or when you investigate game memory to see how clips are stored in the clip dictionary.
member.returns: A that has the calculated hash.

member.name: M:GTA.CrClipAsset.Equals(GTA.CrClipAsset)
member.summary: Returns if the Jenkins-one-at-a-time (joaat) hash values of both and match those of , as the game uses joaat hashes as identifiers of clip dictionaries and clip names.

member.name: T:GTA.CrClipDictionary
member.summary: Represents a dictionary struct for an creature clip/animation dictionary, which is created from a ycd file. Note that clip/animation dictionaries are different from clip sets, which is defined in clip_sets.ymt or clip_sets.xml files (you can request clip sets with ).
member.remarks: Although some natives have the string "ANIM_DICT" but there's no ones that have "CLIP_DICT" on the other hand, GTA V doesn't have game classes for animation dictionaries different from clip dictionaries while the exe has rage::crClipDictionary and rage::fwClipDictionaryStore classes.

member.name: P:GTA.CrClipDictionary.Name
member.summary: Gets the name.

member.name: M:GTA.CrClipDictionary.HashName
member.summary: Computes the hash of in the same way as how the game calculates hashes for clip dictionaries to store in the global rage::fwClipDictionaryStore and as how calculates. May be useful when you want to get the identifier in the same way as how the game handles texture dictionaries or when you investigate game memory to see how clips are stored in clip dictionaries.
member.returns: The hash value calculated from .

member.name: T:GTA.DecoratorInterface
member.summary: Represents the global decorator interface (internally CDecoratorInterface) where variables can be accessed across scripts.

remarks.para: Decorator names are hashed in the same way as before being used.
Despite get/set methods only accepts s at the moment in this class, the relevant native functions take any values associated to guids (e.g. entity handles).

member.name: T:GTA.Entity
member.summary: Represents a physical entity.
member.remarks: Although there are natives that can work with any `CEntity`s including non-`CPhysical` instances, such as `DOES_ENTITY_EXIST`, `HAS_ENTITY_CLEAR_LOS_TO_ENTITY`, this type can safely handle only for `CPhysical`s due to historical reasons. Despite the name, this class also has methods and properties that can work only with physical entities (`CPhysical`s) but not with non-physical entities such as buildings (`CBuilding`s).

member.name: M:GTA.Entity.FromHandle(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of an from the given handle.
member.param: The entity handle.
member.returns: Returns a if this handle corresponds to a (`CPed`). Returns a if this handle corresponds to a (`CVehicle`). Returns a if this handle corresponds to a (`CProp`). Returns if no associated with exists, or if there is a `CEntity` associated with but it is not `CPed`, `CVehicle`, or `CProp`.

member.summary:
Gets a value that indicates whether this has a drawable object.
and PLAY_SYNCHRONIZED_ENTITY_ANIM require the to have a drawable. You can use this property to check that the entity has a drawable before attempting to play the anim.
member.value: if this has a drawable object; otherwise, .

member.name: P:GTA.Entity.HasSkeleton
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this has a skeleton. requires the to have a skeleton. You can use this property to check that the entity has a skeleton before calling that method.
member.value: if this has a skeleton; otherwise, .

member.name: P:GTA.Entity.HasAnimationDirector
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this has an animation director (rage::fwAnimDirector). requires the to have an animation director. You can use this property to check that the entity has an animation director before calling that method.
member.value: if this has an animation director; otherwise, .
member.remarks: Although DOES_ENTITY_HAVE_ANIM_DIRECTOR is only available in v1.0.2699.0 or later, you can successfully call this property in all game versions.

member.name: P:GTA.Entity.IsOwnedByShvdnScript
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this is owned by a SHVDN script including the console. When this property returns , you can successfully call .
member.remarks: Strictly speaking, this property returns true if the CGameScriptHandler associated with this matches the one of the SHVDN runtime script. Although this property calls DOES_ENTITY_BELONG_TO_THIS_SCRIPT, ScriptHookVDotNet uses a shared GtaThread since and the SHVDN runtime script registers only one script via Script Hook V and thus the SHVDN runtime uses only one CGameScriptHandler instance for all SHVDN scripts (which is held by the GtaThread of SHVDN runtime script). This behavior is very similar to how RAGE Plugin Hook executes its plugins in how game resources are managed (not in how .NET assemblies are managed, however).

member.name: P:GTA.Entity.IsOwnedByAnyScript
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this is owned by a script including ysc scripts or external scripts other than SHVDN.

member.name: P:GTA.Entity.OwnerScriptName
member.summary: Gets the script name of the scrThread that owns this . Although you can get distinct names of ysc scripts with this property, you should not except that you can get a distinct name for external scripts, since both Script Hook V and RAGE Plugin Hook use shared script names for all scripts/plugins.
member.remarks: This property will return if no script owns this . If some Script Hook V script (including SHVDN) owns this , this property should return "audiotest" (or "AudioTest"). If some RAGE Plugin Hook plugin owns this , this property should return "RagePluginHook".

member.name: P:GTA.Entity.MaxHealthFloat
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum health of this as a .
member.value: The maximum health as a .

remarks.para: This method also set value to the 16-bit unsigned integer field for the max health of the player ped(s) on CPlayerInfo to prevent them from having inconsistent max health values. while the base implementation of does not care about it at all since there is , where the max health of the player ped(s) on CPlayerInfo is considered.

You should not set a value larger than 65535.0 or a negative value for the player ped(s) as the game uses the 16-bit unsigned integer value for the max health of the player ped(s) on CPlayerInfo and it is used when respawning and in SET_ENTITY_MAX_HEALTH as the max limit. Setting a value larger than 65535.0 will result in the overflow of the 16-bit unsigned integer value for the max health of CPlayerInfo.

member.name: P:GTA.Entity.IsInWater
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is in water.
member.value: if this is in water; otherwise, .

remarks.para:
For s, this property returns if;
or the is in a and the is drowning
or the is swimming where is set
or the is dead (where returns , not ) or a network clone, and then `CPED_RESET_FLAG_IsDrowning` (the 3rd one, whose index is 2) is set
or returns
`IS_ENTITY_IN_WATER` evaluates in the order listed above.

For s, this property returns if;
the vehicle type is and the boat's boat handling instance has the "boat in water" flag set
or the vehicle type inherits from and the automobile's boat handling instance has the "boat in water" flag set
or the vehicle type inherits from , and then or returns
or returns
`IS_ENTITY_IN_WATER` evaluates in the order listed above.
For s, always returns what returns.

member.name: P:GTA.Entity.WasInWater

member.name: P:GTA.Entity.DontLoadCollision
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the game should not try to load collision for this . Sets to when s created and when their mission state is cleaned up (e.g. by calling ).
member.value: if the game should not try to load collision for this ; otherwise, .

remarks.para: Setting this property to does not always make the game try to load collision for this , as the game relies on the const virtual function `CPhysical::ShouldLoadCollision()`. `CVehicle`, which is for, overrides it with a function where `CVehicle::IsDummy()` (which tests the vehicle's lod flags) must also return before the overriding function can return .

When the const virtual function `CPhysical::ShouldLoadCollision()` returns on the , the 2 following effects can happen:
The game requests static bounds (mover) for mission s. must not return before the game can request static bounds. For s and s, or `CPed::GetIsDeadOrDying()` (which `IS_PED_DEAD_OR_DYING` native checks) must not return respectively, either.
`CPhysical::ShouldLoadCollision()` will be evaluated after static-casting to `CPhysical`, and any overridden functions will not be used. Despite the fact that static-cast will not be done for s, `CPhysical` one will be used in that case as `CObject` does not have overriding one.
A `CPortalTracker` instance can trigger activation of interiors mission s, using `CPhysical::ShouldLoadCollision()` without upcasting. For s and s except for the local player , must also be before a `CPortalTracker` can trigger activation of interiors. For s, they must also be owned by a script.

member.name: P:GTA.Entity.AllowsFreezeWaitingOnCollision

member.value: the should be allowed to have its physics frozen if collision has not streamed in around its position; otherwise, .
member.remarks: You should set vehicle fix/freeze properties via when you want to some s to be allowed to have its physics frozen if collision has not streamed in around them. For s and s, setting a value via this property has the same visible effect as the said method.

member.name: M:GTA.Entity.SetShouldFreezeWaitingOnCollision(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether this should be allowed to have its physics frozen if collision has not streamed in around its position. A specific vehicle flag is set if the is a to ensure that it should be fixed.

member.remarks: if the is a , the method also changes `CVehicle::VehicleFlags::bShouldFixIfNoCollision`, which much more internal game functions for vehicles rely on than the bit field and this method set.

member.name: P:GTA.Entity.MaterialCollidingWith
member.summary: Gets the material the entity of which this is pushing up against with the largest accumulated impulse this frame.
member.value: A material hash if this has collision; otherwise, .

remarks.para: Despite this property using GET_LAST_MATERIAL_HIT_BY_ENTITY, it returns the material of the entity that this is pushing up against with the largest accumulated impulse this frame (among all of CEntitys that this is pushing up).

This returns in some cases even if this entity is internally pushing up against something. For example, this returns when this is a and the doesn't push none of the touching entities, including static or animated buildings, since the doesn't have any collision records at that time. However, this returns when this touches any ragdolled ped with the largest accumulated impulse.
Note that when this is a this and its wheels touch something but the does not, the game will consider the entity touching nothing and this returns .
