member.name: M:GTA.Entity.ActivatePhysics
member.summary: Activates the physics of this by having a physics collider (rage::phCollider) for the , which is needed to physically move in both linear and rotational motions (not needed for entity animations or any bones rotating). Needs to return before calling this method can successfully have the activate the physics.
member.remarks: This method is not appropriate to keep the having its physics collider. Use to keep it.

member.name: M:GTA.Entity.DeactivatePhysics
member.summary: Deactivates the physics of this by destroying its rage::phCollider so the can't physically move in both linear and rotational motions. Does not stop animations or any bones rotating, since they have nothing to do with rage::phCollider.

member.name: M:GTA.Entity.SetToRespondToPhysicsSystem

summary.para: Sets the entity to respond to the physics system. Needs to return before calling this method has actual effects.
Keeps this having its physics collider (rage::phCollider) if the entity has a physics collider, where returns ; otherwise, activates the physics of this (same effect as in such case).

member.remarks: You need to call this method as long as you want to keep this having its physics collider, since this method only sets certain variables to certain values on its rage::phCollider so it will not be destroyed by game code in the next frame if the is using a rage::phCollider.

member.name: M:GTA.Entity.ApplyForceInternal(GTA.Math.Vector3,GTA.Math.Vector3,GTA.ForceType,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applies a force to this .
member.param: The force to be applied.
The offset from center of entity at which to apply force.
Type of the force to apply.
Specifies whether the force vector passed in is in relative or world coordinates. Local coordinates () means the force will get automatically transformed into world space before being applied.
Specifies whether the offset passed in is in relative or world coordinates.

param.name: scaleByMass
param.para: Specifies whether to scale the force by mass.
If , force will be multiplied by mass. For example, force passed in is in fact an acceleration rate in m/s*s (force) or velocity change in m/s (impulse).

If , force will be applied directly and it's effect will depend on the mass of the entity. For example, force passed in is a proper force in Newtons (force) or a step change in momentum kg*m/s (impulse).

In other words, scaling by mass is probably easier in most situations - if the mass of the object changes it's behaviour shouldn't, and it's easier to picture the effect because an acceleration rate of 10.0 is approximately the same as gravity (9.81 to be more precise).

param.name: triggerAudio
param.para: Specifies whether to play audio events related to the force being applied. The sound will play only if the entity type is and will play a suspension squeal depending on the magnitude of the force.
The sound will play even if regardless of (even with a value other than between 0 to 5).

param.name: scaleByTimeScale
param.para: Specifies whether scale the force by the current time scale (max: 1.0f).
Only affects when is or .

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the animation event has been fired from an animation this is playing. Use this to check if a particular event tag is present in an animation playing on the this frame. Some events are instantaneous (so this will only return true once). Others may have duration, which means that this function may continuously return for a range of values.
member.param: The event hash. Use to convert the original event name to the hash.
member.remarks: The event must have been tagged with the VisibleToScript attribute (joaat hash: 0xF301E135) in the ycd animation file to make it detectable with this method. Events can include one or more attributes of different types that can be used to get data from the animation.

member.name: P:GTA.EntityBoneCollection.Item(System.String)

summary.para: Gets the with the specified bone name. If the corresponding bone is not found, the of the returned instance will return -1. To access to the chassis bone of , use with the index 0 as the chassis bone index and ID will always be 0 (hardcoded to the exe).

This method will try to find the corresponding bone by the hash calculated with (ElfHashUppercased(string) % 0xFE8F + 0x170), where ElfHashUppercased(string) will convert ASCII lowercase characters to uppercase ones before hashing characters.

member.param: Name of the bone.
member.remarks: Registered bone tag values (in the model) may be different from the calculated hashes from corresponding bone names. For example, s have the bone in their skeletons whose name is SKEL_Spine3 and whose ID is 24818, which doesn't match the hashed value of SKEL_Spine3 but matches that of BONETAG_SPINE3.

member.name: T:GTA.AnimationFlags
member.summary: An enumeration of all the non-IK flags that the scripted animation task class (CTaskScriptedAnimation) uses.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.Loop
member.summary: Repeat the animation.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.StayInEndFrame
member.summary: Hold on the last frame of the animation.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.RepositionWhenFinished
member.summary: When the animation finishes pop the peds physical representation position to match the visual representations position. Note that the animator of the animation must not unwind the animation and must have an independent mover node.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.NotInterruptable
member.summary: The task cannot be interrupted by external events.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.UpperBodyOnly
member.summary: Only plays the upper body part of the animation. Dampens any motion caused by the lower body animation.Note that the animation should include the root node.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.Secondary
member.summary: The task will run in the secondary task slot. This means it can be used as well as a movement task (for instance).

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.ReorientWhenFinished
member.summary: When the animation finishes pop the peds physical representation direction to match the visual representations direction. Note that the animator of the animation must not unwind the animation and must have an independent mover node.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.AbortOnPedMovement
member.summary: Ends the animation early if the ped attempts to move e.g. if the player tries to move using the controller. Can also be used to blend out automatically when an AI ped starts moving by combining it with the flag.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.Additive
member.summary: Play back the animation additively. Note that this will only produce sensible results on specifically authored additive animations.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.TurnOffCollision
member.summary: Do not react to collision detection whilst this anim is playing.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.OverridePhysics
member.summary: Do not apply any physics forces whilst the anim is playing. Automatically turns off collision, extracts any initial offset provided in the clip and uses per frame mover extraction.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.IgnoreGravity
member.summary: Do not apply gravity while the anim is playing.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.ExtractInitialOffset
member.summary: Extract an initial offset from the playback position authored by the animator. Use this flag when playing back anims on different peds which have been authored to sync with each other.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.ExitAfterInterrupted
member.summary: Exit the animation task if it is interrupted by another task (ie Natural Motion). Without this flag bing set looped animations will restart ofter the NM task

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.TagSyncIn
member.summary: Sync the anim whilst blending in (use for seamless transitions from walk / run into a full body anim).
member.remarks: Tag synchronizer flags are for syncing the anim against ped movement (walking / running / etc).

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.TagSyncOut
member.summary: Sync the anim whilst blending out (use for seamless transitions from a full body anim into walking / running behaviour).
member.remarks: Tag synchronizer flags are for syncing the anim against ped movement (walking / running / etc).

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.TagSyncContinuous
member.summary: Sync all the time (Only useful to synchronize a partial anim e.g. an upper body).
member.remarks: Tag synchronizer flags are for syncing the anim against ped movement (walking / running / etc).

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.ForceStart
member.summary: Force the anim task to start even if the ped is falling / ragdolling / etc. Can fix issues with peds not playing their anims immediately after a warp / etc.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.UseKinematicPhysics
member.summary: Use the kinematic physics mode on the entity for the duration of the anim (it should push other entities out of the way, and not be pushed around by players / etc).

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.UseMoverExtraction
member.summary: Updates the peds capsule position every frame based on the animation. Use in conjunction with to create characters that cannot be pushed off course by other entities / geometry / etc whilst playing the anim.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.HideWeapon
member.summary: Indicates that the ped's weapon should be hidden while this animation is playing.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.EndsInDeadPose
member.summary: When the anim ends, kill the ped and use the currently playing anim as the dead pose.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.RagdollOnCollision
member.summary: If the peds ragdoll bounds make contact with something physical (that isn't flat ground) activate the ragdoll and fall over.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.DontExitOnDeath
member.summary: Currently used only on secondary anim tasks. Secondary anim tasks will end automatically when the ped dies. Setting this flag stops that from happening.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.AbortOnWeaponDamage
member.summary: Allow aborting from damage events (including non-ragdoll damage events) even when blocking other ai events using .

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.DisableForcedPhysicsUpdate
member.summary: Prevent adjusting the capsule on the enter state (useful if script is doing a sequence of scripted anims and they are known to more or less stand still).

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.ProcessAttachmentsOnStart
member.summary: Force the attachments to be processed at the start of the clip.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.ExpandPedCapsuleFromSkeleton
member.summary: Expands the capsule to the extents of the skeleton.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.UseAlternativeFirstPersonAnim
member.summary: Plays an alternative first person version of the clip on the player when in first person mode. The first person clip must be in the same dictionary, and be named the same as the anim you're playing, but with _FP appended on the end.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.BlendOutWRTLastFrame
member.summary: Start blending out the anim early, so that the blend out duration completes at the end of the animation.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationFlags.UseFullBlending
member.summary: Use full blending for this anim and override the heading/position adjustment in CTaskScriptedAnimation::CheckIfClonePlayerNeedsHeadingPositionAdjust(), so that the game doesn't correct errors (special case such as scrip-side implemented AI tasks, i.e. diving)

member.name: T:GTA.AnimationIKControlFlags
member.summary: An enumeration of all the IK flags that the scripted animation task class (CTaskScriptedAnimation) uses.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationIKControlFlags.None

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationIKControlFlags.DisableLegIK

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationIKControlFlags.DisableArmIK

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationIKControlFlags.DisableTorsoReactIK
member.summary: Disable torso react ik during the task.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationIKControlFlags.UseLegAllowTags
member.summary: Use anim leg allow tags to determine when leg ik is enabled.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationIKControlFlags.UseLegBlockTags
member.summary: Use anim leg block tags to determine when leg ik is disabled.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationIKControlFlags.UseArmAllowTags
member.summary: Use anim arm allow tags to determine when ik is enabled.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationIKControlFlags.UseArmBlockTags
member.summary: Use anim arm block tags to determine when ik is disabled.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationIKControlFlags.ProcessWeaponHandGrip
member.summary: Process the left hand weapon grip ik during the task.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationIKControlFlags.UseFirstPersonArmLeft
member.summary: Use first person ik setup for left arm (cannot be used with AIK_DISABLE_ARM_IK).

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationIKControlFlags.UseFirstPersonArmRight
member.summary: Use first person ik setup for right arm (cannot be used with AIK_DISABLE_ARM_IK).

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationIKControlFlags.DisableTorsoVehicleIK
member.summary: Disable torso vehicle ik during the task.

member.name: F:GTA.AnimationIKControlFlags.LinkedFacial
member.summary: Searches the dictionary of the clip being played for another clip with the _facial suffix to be played as a facial animation.

member.name: T:GTA.Bone
member.summary: An enumeration of possible bone tag values for , which is for eAnimBoneTag.
member.remarks: This enum has normal bone tag values in the range of uint16_t and has BONETAG_INVALID with the value -1 (0xFFFFFFFF). eAnimBoneTag specifies 32 bit type for its enum subtype. rage::parMemberEnum itself supports 32 bit, 16 bit, and 8 bit values for enums in all RAGE games until GTA V (64 bit enums are supported starting from RDR3).

member.name: F:GTA.Bone.Invalid
member.summary: The corresponding bone tag value for BONETAG_INVALID, which is used in some meta/xml files such as weapon meta files and damages.meta.

member.name: T:GTA.CombatAttributes
member.summary: An enumeration of known combat attributes (combat behavior flags) for the , which is used to set or unset the combat attributes on a CPedIntelligence of CPed.
member.remarks: You can check if names of this enum are included in the exe by searching the dumped exe for hashed values of names like BF_[enum name] without case conversion (for example, search the dumped exe for 0x61C7368E, which is the hashed value of BF_CanUseCover). The corresponding enum name in the exe is CCombatData__BehaviourFlags (the joaat hash value is 0xE8E7201, where the original name is CCombatData::BehaviourFlags but ':' characters are replaced with '_').

member.name: F:GTA.CombatAttributes.CanUseCover
member.summary: AI will only use cover if this is set.

member.summary: AI will only use s if this is set.

member.summary: If in combat and in a , the will flee rather than attacking.

member.summary: can investigate events such as distant gunfire, footsteps, explosions etc.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatAttributes.AlwaysFlee
member.summary: will always flee upon getting threat response task.

member.summary: can do unarmed taunts in .

member.summary: can drag injured s to safety.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatAttributes.CanUseFrustratedAdvance
member.summary: If we don't have cover and can't see our target it's possible we will advance, even if the target is in cover.

member.summary: will try to maintain a min distance to the target, even if using defensive areas (currently only for cover finding + usage).

member.name: T:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes
member.summary: An enumeration of known combat float attributes for ,
member.remarks: Almost all the initial values can be set for configs that this enum lists with CCombatInfo configs, which are instantiated from the combatbehaviour.meta file.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.BlindFireChance
member.summary: Chance to blind fire from cover, range is 0.0-1.0 (default is 0.05 for civilians, law doesn't blind fire).

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.BurstDurationInCover
member.summary: How long each burst from cover should last (default is 2.0).

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.MaxShootingDistance
member.summary: The maximum distance the will try to shoot from (will override weapon range if set to anything > 0.0, default is -1.0)

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.TimeBetweenBurstsInCover
member.summary: How long to wait, in cover, between firing bursts (< 0.0 will disable firing, unless cover fire is requested, default is 1.25).

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.TimeBetweenPeeks
member.summary: How long to wait before attempting to peek again (default is 10.0).

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.StrafeWhenMovingChance
member.summary: A chance to strafe to cover, range is 0.0-1.0 (0.0 will force them to run, 1.0 will force strafe and shoot, default is 1.0).

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.WeaponAccuracy
member.summary: A chance to shoot at exactly where the points at. This attribute is for the float value that actually reads/writes.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.FightProficiency
member.summary: How well an opponent can melee fight, range is 0.0-1.0.
member.remarks: Cannot be set in combatbehaviours.meta.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.WalkWhenStrafingChance
member.summary: The possibility of a walking while strafing rather than jog/run, range is 0.0-1.0 (default is 0.0).

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.HeliSpeedModifier
member.summary: The speed modifier when driving a heli in combat.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.HeliSensesRange
member.summary: The range of the 's senses (sight, identification, hearing) when in a heli.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.AttackWindowDistanceForCover
member.summary: The distance the game will use for cover based behaviour in attack windows Default is -1.0 (disabled), range is -1.0 to 150.0.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.TimeToInvalidateInjuredTarget
member.summary: How long to stop combat an injured target if there is no other valid target, if target is player in singleplayer, this will happen indefinitely unless explicitly disabled by setting to 0.0, default = 10.0 range = 0-50.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.MinimumDistanceToTarget
member.summary: Min distance the will use if is set, default 5.0.
member.remarks: There was the note "(currently only for cover search + usage)" in a official scripting header, but it is unknown when the word "currently" in the note specifies.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.BulletImpactDetectionRange
member.summary: The range at which the will detect the bullet impact event.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.AimTurnThreshold
member.summary: The threshold at which the will perform an aim turn.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.AutomobileSpeedModifier
member.summary: The speed modifier when driving an automobile in combat.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.TriggerChargeTimeFar
member.summary: How long to wait before charging a close target hiding in cover.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.TriggerChargeTimeNear
member.summary: How long to wait before charging a distant target hiding in cover.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.MaxDistanceToHearEvents
member.summary: Max distance s can hear an event from, even if the sound is louder.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.MaxDistanceToHearEventsUsingLOS
member.summary: Max distance s can hear an event from, even if the sound is louder if the is using LOS to hear events ().

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.HomingRocketBreakLockAngle
member.summary: Angle between the rocket and target where lock-on will stop, range is 0.0-1.0, (default is 0.2), the bigger the number the easier to break lock.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.HomingRocketBreakLockAngleClose
member.summary: Angle between the rocket and target where lock-on will stop, when rocket is within , range is 0.0-1.0, (default is 0.6), the bigger the number the easier to break lock.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.HomingRocketBreakLockCloseDistance
member.summary: Distance at which the game check rather than .

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.HomingRocketTurnRateModifier
member.summary: Alters homing characteristics defined for the weapon (1.0 is default, <1.0 slow turn rates, >1.0 speed them up.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.TimeBetweenAggressiveMovesDuringVehicleChase
member.summary: Sets the time delay between aggressive moves during vehicle chases. -1.0 means use random values, 0.0 means never.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.MaxVehicleTurretFiringRange
member.summary: Max firing range for a in vehicle turret seat.

member.name: F:GTA.CombatFloatAttributes.WeaponDamageModifier
member.summary: Multiplies the weapon damage dealt by the , range is 0.0-10.0 (default is 1.0).

member.name: T:GTA.EventType
member.summary: An enumeration of all possible event types except for network and error events.

member.summary: Not available in 1.0.1737.6 or earlier.

member.name: F:GTA.EventType.ShockingBrokenGlass

member.name: T:GTA.FleeAttributes
member.summary: An enumeration of known flee attributes for the , which is used to set or unset the flee attributes on a CPedIntelligence of CPed.
member.remarks: You can set or unset multiple attributes as SET_PED_FLEE_ATTRIBUTES set or unset the bits of flee attributes by just using simple bitwise operation (adds bits if the bool parameter is set, removes bits if the bool is not set).

member.name: F:GTA.FleeAttributes.CanScream
member.remarks: Set by default on creation if the ped model definition, which is instantiated from a peds.ymt or peds.meta file (exists as a CPedModelInfo in the game memory), has a reference to CTaskDataInfo (defined in taskdata.meta) where the Flags field has CanScreamDuringFlee.

member.name: F:GTA.FleeAttributes.PreferPavements
member.remarks: Set by default on creation if the ped model definition, which is instantiated from a peds.ymt or peds.meta file (exists as a CPedModelInfo in the game memory), has a reference to CTaskDataInfo (defined in taskdata.meta) where the Flags field has PreferFleeOnPavements.

member.name: T:GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags
member.summary: Set of flags which may be passed in to and . The latter overload takes 3 additional parameters, which in some cases must contain values required for the extra functionality - where this is the case it is described in the individual documents of the flags.

member.name: F:GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags.NoStopping
member.summary: Will ensure the continues to move whilst waiting for the path to be found, and will not slow down at the end of their route.

member.name: F:GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags.AdvancedSlideToCoordAndAchieveHeadingAtEnd
member.summary: Performs a slide-to-coord at the and of the task. This requires that the parameter slideToCoordHeading is set correctly.

member.name: F:GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags.GoFarAsPossibleIfTargetNavmeshNotLoaded
member.summary: If the navmesh is not loaded in under the target position, then this will cause the ped to get as close as is possible on whatever navmesh is loaded. The navmesh must still be loaded at the path start.

member.name: F:GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags.AllowSwimmingUnderwater
member.summary: Will allow navigation underwater - by default this is not allowed.

member.name: F:GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags.KeepToPavements
member.summary: Will only allow navigation on pavements. If the path starts or ends off the pavement, the command will fail. Likewise if no pavement-only route can be found even although the start and end are on pavement.

member.name: F:GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags.NeverEnterWater
member.summary: Prevents the path from entering water at all.

member.name: F:GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags.DontAvoidObjects
member.summary: Disables object-avoidance for this path. The ped may still make minor steering adjustments to avoid objects, but will not pathfind around them.

member.name: F:GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags.AdvancedUseMaxSlopeNavigable
member.summary: Specifies that the navmesh route will only be able to traverse up slopes which are under the angle specified in the parameter maxSlopeNavigable.

member.name: F:GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags.AccurateWalkRunStart
member.summary: The entity will look ahead in its path for a longer distance to make the walk/run start go more in the right direction. Especially useful when ped start from inside an object boundaries but has to be used carefully, the ped might be more prone to walk into things during the walk/runstart with this flag set.

member.name: F:GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags.DontAvoidPeds
member.summary: Disables ped-avoidance for this path while we move.

member.name: F:GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags.DontAdjustTargetPosition
member.summary: If target pos is inside the bounding box of an object it will otherwise be pushed out. This flag should be used with extreme caution. Use only if asked specifically to use this.

member.name: F:GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags.SuppressExactStop
member.summary: Turns off the default behaviour, which is to stop exactly at the target position. Occasionally this can cause footsliding/skating problems.

member.name: F:GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags.AdvancedUseClampMaxSearchDistance
member.summary: Prevents the path-search from finding paths outside of this search distance. This can be used to prevent peds from finding long undesired routes. The value the parameter clampMaxSearchDistance must be set, and this value must be between 1 and 255 (corresponds to game units). The seach area is limited to an axis aligned box containing a sphere of the given radius.

member.name: F:GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags.PullFromEdgeExtra
member.summary: Pulls out the paths from edges at corners for a longer distance, to prevent peds walking into stuff. This could in rare cases generate bigger quirks in the paths so use only when it is necessary.

member.name: F:GTA.ForceAnimAIUpdateState.CutsceneExit
member.summary: Sets additional reset flags to do CameraAIUpdate and PostCameraAnimUpdate on the .

member.name: F:GTA.Formation.Loose
member.summary: The default value.

member.name: T:GTA.HelmetPropFlags
member.summary: An enumeration of possible helmet prop flags for s. This flags will restrict helmet types using AND bitwise, so no helmet props will be used if none of the available helmet props are found that match all the flags specified. The original enum name should be ePedCompFlags, but this enum uses HelmetPropFlags instead of PedComponentFlags as this enum is only used for native functions for ped helmets in practice.
member.remarks: You can check if the listed enum names are correct by searching the dumped exe for hashed values like PV_FLAG_[enum name (snake case)] (PV would stand for PedVariation).

member.name: F:GTA.HelmetPropFlags.Armored
member.summary: Specifies helmets that disables the critical hit on the (regardless of ).
member.remarks: The original name is PV_FLAG_ARMOURED, but this enum uses the american name.

member.name: F:GTA.HelmetPropFlags.LightlyArmored
member.remarks: The original name is PV_FLAG_LIGHTLY_ARMOURED, but this enum uses the american name.

member.name: F:GTA.HelmetPropFlags.DefaultHelmet
member.summary: Regular motorcycle helmets should be used for most s.

member.name: F:GTA.HelmetPropFlags.RandomHelmet
member.summary: Different helmets may be used for some models (e.g. ).

member.name: P:GTA.Ped.WetnessHeight
member.summary: Sets how high up on this s body water should be visible.
member.value: The height offset ranges from -2f to 1.99f inclusive, -2f being no water visible, 1.99f being fully covered in water.
member.remarks: Although zero sets the height offset of the water line to zero in meters on water height members of CPed, This property will clear the wet/soaked effect if the value is set to the zero for the compatibility of scripts built against v3.6.0.

member.name: P:GTA.Ped.LowerWetnessHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower wetness height of this . The value should be in the range of 0 and 1 inclusive.

remarks.para: and must be set before this value can have affect. If is -2f or less or and is zero or less, this value will be transferred to and then this value will be set to -2f.
The value must be less than , otherwise the value will be reset to -2f in a few frames.

member.name: P:GTA.Ped.UpperWetnessHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper wetness height of this . The value should be in the range of 0 and 1 inclusive.

member.name: P:GTA.Ped.LowerWetnessLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower wetness level of this .
member.value: The height offset of the lower water line in meters. Should be in the range of -2f exclusive and 1.99f inclusive. If the value is -2f or less, the wetness effect will be cleared in a few frames. If the value is more than 1.99f (not 2f), the value will be clamped to 1.99f.

remarks.para: If the does not exist, this method will return -2f, which is the default value that indicates the is not wet.
and must be set before this value can have affect. If is -2f or less or and is zero or less, this value will be transferred to and then this value will be set to zero.

remarks.para: If the does not exist, this method will return -2f, which is the default value that indicates the is not wet.
This value and must be set before can have affect.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum health of this as an .
member.value: The maximum health as an .

remarks.para: will be changed when the setter is called if the is one for a player.

You should not set a value larger than 65535 or a negative value for the player ped(s) as the game uses the 16-bit unsigned integer value for the max health of the player ped(s) on CPlayerInfo and it is used when respawning and in SET_ENTITY_MAX_HEALTH as the max limit. Setting a value larger than 65535 will result in the overflow of the 16-bit unsigned integer value for the max health of CPlayerInfo.

member.name: P:GTA.Ped.BlockPermanentEvents

summary.para: Gets or sets whether non-temporary events without high priorities are blocked for this .
For example, the will not flee when get shot at and they will not begin combat even if specifies that seeing a hated ped should.

remarks.para:
Even if this property is set to , the will still respond to events that meet one of the following criteria;
Priority is higher than that of "block non-temp events" (or the same). Examples;
Event for the 's being on fire (`CEventVehicleOnFire`)
Event for taking damage (`CEventDamage` with 4 possible priorities)
Event for getting bumped into by another (`CEventPedCollisionWithPed` and `CEventPedCollisionWithPlayer`, whose priorities are the same)
Event for taking damage (`CEventDamage` with 4 possible priorities)
Event is set to be temporary. Examples;
Event for vehicle on fire (`CEventVehicleOnFire`)
Event for being about to walk into fire (`CEventPotentialWalkIntoFire`)
Event for the 's being upside down, beached, or stuck (`CEventCarUndriveable`)
Event type is set to one of the following types;
`EVENT_SCRIPT_COMMAND`
`EVENT_LEADER_ENTERED_CAR_AS_DRIVER`
`EVENT_LEADER_EXITED_CAR_AS_DRIVER`
`EVENT_SCENARIO_FORCE_ACTION`

member.value: if non-temporary events without high priorities are blocked; otherwise, .

member.name: P:GTA.Ped.RandomPedsBlockingNonTempEventsThisFrame
member.summary: Sets the value that indicates whether non-temp events without high priorities will be blocked for random/ambient s this frame. Excludes law enforcement s.
member.remarks: Strictly, if this property is set to , the game will block non-temp events this frame on s with one of the random population types (e.g. ) and with a other than , , or .

member.name: P:GTA.Ped.IsInjured

summary.para: Gets a value indicating whether this is injured ( of the is lower than ) or does not exist.

Since s cannot start any scripted tasks if you try to give injured s some of them, this property should be used to determine if the is able to do anything in the game (i.e. run scripted tasks) instead of . You can reproduce the case where you give some a scripted task but it will not start by modifying and then giving them a scripted task. should be used only if you want to specifically know that the is dead.
Can be safely called to check if s exist and are not injured without calling .

member.value: this is injured or does not exist; otherwise, .
member.remarks: Since GTA IV, Rockstar Games use the equivalent native function (IS_PED_INJURED in GTA V) to check if some is (almost) dead instead of the equivalent one (IS_ENTITY_DEAD in GTA V) of in most cases.

member.remarks: Although GET_PED_TARGET_FROM_COMBAT_PED is not present in v1.0.2245.0 or earlier game versions, this property supports all game versions. Unlike the native, this property does not check if the is running CTaskCombat before this property can return a valid . The native would return a valid if it is in the case where a CTaskCombat would be found on an inactive task tree of CTaskTreePed, however, since it traverse the first CTaskInfo and its nodes on CPedIntelligence, not the active task tree.

Clears the record of the cause of death that killed this with. Can be useful after resurrecting this .

Clears the time record when this is killed. Can be useful after resurrecting this .

member.name: P:GTA.Ped.DiesInstantlyInWater
member.summary: Sets whether this will die instantly if they find themselves in a body of water.

remarks.para: The complete submersion into water does not guarantee this will die if this is the local player. In details, the with this flag enabled will not die by being in water if this is the local player, the is , and the motion task data associated with the (which is set based on motiontasks.ymt) has non-null InWater (PED_IN_WATER type) data.
Resets to when the is marked as no longer needed, which can be done with unless is running a task with the type TASK_ON_FOOT_FISH.

member.name: M:GTA.Ped.ApplyForceInternal(GTA.Math.Vector3,GTA.Math.Vector3,GTA.ForceType,GTA.RagdollComponent,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applies a force to this .
member.param: The force to be applied.
The offset from center of entity at which to apply force.
Type of the force to apply.
Component of the entity to apply the force.
Specifies whether the force vector passed in is in relative or world coordinates. Relative coordinates () means the force will get automatically transformed into world space before being applied.
Specifies whether the offset passed in is in relative or world coordinates.

param.name: scaleByMass
param.para: Specifies whether to scale the force by mass.
If , force will be multiplied by mass. For example, force passed in is in fact an acceleration rate in m/s*s (force) or velocity change in m/s (impulse).

If , force will be applied directly and it's effect will depend on the mass of the entity. For example, force passed in is a proper force in Newtons (force) or a step change in momentum kg*m/s (impulse).

In other words, scaling by mass is probably easier in most situations - if the mass of the object changes it's behaviour shouldn't, and it's easier to picture the effect because an acceleration rate of 10.0 is approximately the same as gravity (9.81 to be more precise).

param.name: triggerAudio
param.para: Specifies whether to play audio events related to the force being applied. The sound will play only if the entity type is and will play a suspension squeal depending on the magnitude of the force.
The sound will play even if regardless of (even with a value other than between 0 to 5).

param.name: scaleByTimeScale
param.para: Specifies whether scale the force by the current time scale (max: 1.0f).
Only affects when is or .

member.exception: Thrown when not a value defined in .

In other words, scaling by mass is probably easier in most situations - if the mass of the object changes it's behaviour shouldn't, and it's easier to picture the effect because an acceleration rate of 10.0 is approximately the same as gravity (9.81 to be more precise).

member.param: Specifies whether to apply force to children components as well as the speficied component.
member.exception: Thrown when is set to or , which is not supported by this method.
Thrown when not a value defined in .

member.name: M:GTA.Ped.SetIKTarget(GTA.IKPart,GTA.PedBone,GTA.Math.Vector3,GTA.IKTargetFlags,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the IK target for a given IK part belonging to this .
member.param: The IK Part to set.
The target .
The target offset relative to the bone.
The flags.
The blend in time in milliseconds. Set to -1 for default blend in time. Set to 0 for instant blend in time.
The blend out time in milliseconds. Set to -1 for default blend out time. Set to 0 for instant blend out time.
member.remarks: The IK target will only be valid for one update, so it needs to be set for as long as it is needed (to avoid IK targets not being cleared and getting stuck enabled).

The flags.

The blend out time in milliseconds. Set to -1 for default blend out time. Set to 0 for instant blend out time.

member.summary: Gets the with the specified .

member.summary: Gets the at the specified bone index.

member.name: P:GTA.PedBoneCollection.Item(System.String)

summary.para: Gets the with the specified bone name. Use this overload only if you know a correct bone tag. If the corresponding bone is not found, the of the returned instance will return -1.

This method will try to find the corresponding bone by the hash calculated with (ElfHashUppercased(string) % 0xFE8F + 0x170), where ElfHashUppercased(string) will convert ASCII lowercase characters to uppercase ones before hashing characters.

member.param: Name of the bone.
member.remarks: Registered bone tag values (in the model) may be different from the calculated hashes from corresponding bone names. For example, s have the bones in their skeletons whose name is SKEL_Spine3 and whose ID is 24818, which doesn't match the hashed value of SKEL_Spine3 but matches that of BONETAG_SPINE3. On the other hand, s have the bone in their skeletons whose name is IK_Head and whose ID is 12844, which matches the hashed value of IK_Head.

member.name: P:GTA.PedConfigFlags.PassengerIndexToUseInAGroup
member.summary: Gets or sets the passenger index the should want to be in use when they are in a as a follower. If set to , which is the default value when a is created, the group leader will decide which seat this should be in when the leader entered a vehicle as a driver (using a task response to a event leader event).
member.value: A corresponding value if the internal value is between 0 and 15, or if the internal value is -1 (which is the default value); otherwise, (e.g. when the internal value is between -16 and -2 or SHVDN could not fetch the value).
member.exception: The passenger index is not one of the members of the passenger seats of to specify the passenger index or to let the group leader inform this of which seat this should be in. Only thrown from the setter.
member.remarks: You can force the to use the specified passenger seat only by setting on.

member.name: F:GTA.PedConfigFlagToggles.DisableMelee
member.summary: Disable melee for a (only supported for player right now).

remarks.para: Disables starting melee tasks for player s from the regular player move on foot task `CTaskPlayerOnFoot`, disabling player s to start aiming another with a melee weapon (including unarmed one) and to perform a melee attack task when they are regularly moving.

Does not disable starting melee tasks from any tasks other than `CTaskPlayerOnFoot`, which means this flag does not prevent non-player s from performing melee tasks at all. This flag does not prevent player from performing melee tasks when already aiming another with a melee weapon or performing a combat task for the same reason, either.

member.name: F:GTA.PedConfigFlagToggles.DoNothingWhenOnFootByDefault
member.summary: Do nothing when on foot by default (when computing a default task).
member.remarks:
Another task takes precedence when computing a default task if the meet one of the following criteria in the following order of precedence;
is in (strictly when is set to ). Performs an appropriate task such as `CTaskPlayerDrive` for the local player and `CTaskPolice` for s whose population type is the cop one.
is the local player . Uses a primary motion task.
's is and the is not . Uses a `CTaskSwat`.
's is and the is not . Uses a `CTaskArmy`.
is in a as a follower and it has a leader. Uses a `CTaskFollowLeaderAnyMeans`.
's is . Uses a `CTaskDoNothing`, which means there is no need to set this flag for mission s unless may be called on them later.

member.name: F:GTA.PedConfigFlagToggles.LeaveEngineOnWhenExitingVehicles
member.summary: The player will leave the engine on when exiting a normally.
member.remarks:
The following factors overwrite the "SwitchEngineOff" value evaluated with this flag, which are evaluated in the following order;
If the model (index) is not that of the Oppressor Mk II, then;
The wanted level is 2 or more and the time since last spotted is less than a certain tunable value. Overwrites the evaluated value with .
There is an active Action Mode reason. Overwrites the evaluated value with .
The has the flag that can be set with `SET_VEHICLE_KEEP_ENGINE_ON_WHEN_ABANDONED`. Overwrites the evaluated value with .
The has weapon blades. Overwrites the evaluated value with .
`CVehicleEnterExitFlags::BeJacked` flag is set for the exit task. Overwrites the evaluated value with .
The is using script auto pilot. Overwrites the evaluated value with .

member.name: M:GTA.PedHeadshot.Register(GTA.Ped)
member.summary: Registers a to have their headshot taken (64x64 by default).
member.param: The to have their headshot taken.
member.returns: A instance if successfully requested; otherwise, .
member.remarks: There are 26 slots available for this regular (31 in the game versions prior to v1.0.877.1); if it's already in use, this request will fail and return .

member.name: M:GTA.PedHeadshot.RegisterHiRes(GTA.Ped)
member.summary: Registers a to have their headshot taken with a high resolution texture (128x128 resolution by default). Not available in the game versions earlier than v1.0.877.1.
member.param: The to have their headshot taken.
member.returns: A instance if successfully requested; otherwise, .
member.remarks: There are 7 slot available for transparent ; if it's already in use, this request will fail and return .

member.name: M:GTA.PedHeadshot.RegisterTransparent(GTA.Ped)
member.summary: Registers a to have their headshot taken with a transparent background (128x128 resolution by default).
member.param: The to have their headshot taken with a transparent background.
member.returns: A instance if successfully requested; otherwise, .
member.remarks: There is only one slot available for transparent ; if it's already in use, this request will fail and return .

member.summary: Gets a that represents the texture dictionary (txd) name of this without any status tests. You should not directly use the return value to any methods or native functions that require texture dictionary names, as this method always returns the txd names for the without ANY status tests.
member.remarks: This methods basically returns the same string as pedmugshot_%02d, where is filled in.

member.name: T:GTA.PedPropAnchorPoint
member.summary: An enumeration of anchor points for props (represents what eAnchorPoints in the game represents).

member.name: T:GTA.PedResetFlags
member.summary: Represents a wrapper class for `CPedResetFlags` (not `ePedResetFlags`). The class calls its reset methods every frame, where the members that tracks the remaining numbers of frames get decremented and most of the other values are reset to appropriate values.

member.name: P:GTA.PedResetFlags.NumFramesToBeKnockedByDoor
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frame where the is getting pushed out of the way by the player pushing a door.

member.name: P:GTA.PedResetFlags.NumFramesToSetEntityZFromGround
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frames where the the game can snap the height of the ped to the correct distance above the ground.

member.name: P:GTA.PedResetFlags.NumFramesNotToAcceptIKLookAts
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frames the should not accept any IK look ats. The value takes any number between 0 and 3.
member.exception: The value is not within the range of 0 to 3. Can only be thrown from the setter.

member.name: P:GTA.PedResetFlags.NumFramesNotToAcceptCodeIKLookAts
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frames the should not accept script IK look ats. The value takes any number between 0 and 3.
member.exception: The value is not within the range of 0 to 3. Can only be thrown from the setter.
member.remarks: This property having a value more than zero does not prevent the from looking at initiated by a script, or by some of the game code that's not called via native functions.

member.name: P:GTA.PedResetFlags.NumFramesToConsiderJustLeftVehicle
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frames the should be considered to have just left a . The value takes any number between 0 and 15.
member.exception: The value is not within the range of 0 to 15. Can only be thrown from the setter.

member.name: P:GTA.PedResetFlags.NumFramesToConsiderInCover
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frames the should be considered to have just left a . The value takes any number between 0 and 3.
member.exception: The value is not within the range of 0 to 3. Can only be thrown from the setter.

member.name: P:GTA.PedResetFlags.EntityZFromGroundZHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the absolute Z coordinate of the ground height that determines if the should be snapped to the ground. If close enough and is more than zero, the will be snapped to the ground.

member.name: P:GTA.PedResetFlags.EntityZFromGroundZThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the Z coordinate threshold from the ground height that determines if the should be snapped to the ground. If close enough and is more than zero, the will be snapped to the ground.

member.name: P:GTA.PedResetFlags.IsHeadIKBlocked
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the head IK is blocked for both game code and scripts in this .

member.name: P:GTA.PedResetFlags.IsCodeHeadIKBlocked
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the head IK is blocked for scripts in this .

member.name: P:GTA.PedResetFlags.HasJustLeftVehicle
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this should be considered as have just left a by testing if is not zero.

member.name: P:GTA.PedResetFlags.IsInCover
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this is currently in cover by testing if is not zero.
member.remarks: While how this property is the same as how `bool CPed::GetIsInCover() const` returns true, it is not the same as how SHVDN's returns true, which tests if a `TaskCover` is running on the 's intelligence.

member.name: M:GTA.PedResetFlags.SetIsHeadIKBlocked
member.summary: Sets the head IK of this as blocked.
member.remarks: Sets to the max value, which is 3 at least in the game versions between v1.0.372.2 and v1.0.3179.0.

member.name: M:GTA.PedResetFlags.SetIsCodeHeadIKBlocked
member.summary: Sets the head IK of this as blocked for scripts.
member.remarks: Sets to the max value, which is 3 at least in the game versions between v1.0.372.2 and v1.0.3179.0.

member.name: M:GTA.PedResetFlags.SetEntityZFromGroundZHeight(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the Z coordinate of the ground height and the threshold, which determine if the should be snapped to the ground.
member.param: The absolute Z coordinate of the ground where the is on.
The threshold to determine if the should be snapped.
member.remarks: should be more than zero to snap before calling this method. If the property gets set to zero in the internal reset function, what you set via this method will also be reset.

member.name: M:GTA.PedResetFlags.GetResetFlag(GTA.PedResetFlagToggles)
member.summary: Gets the value of a reset flag toggle on this . You will need to call this method every frame you want to get, since the values of are reset every frame.

member.name: M:GTA.PedResetFlags.SetResetFlag(GTA.PedResetFlagToggles,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the value of a reset flag toggle on this . You will need to call this method every frame you want to set, since the values of are reset every frame.

member.name: T:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles
member.summary: An enumeration of known reset flags for , which will be required to set or get every frame you need to set or get.
member.remarks: You can check if names of this enum are included in the exe by searching the dumped exe for hashed values of names like CPED_RESET_FLAG_[enum name] without case conversion (for example, search the dumped exe for 0x49F290D0, which is the hashed value of CPED_RESET_FLAG_DisablePlayerJumping).

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.FallenDown
member.summary: Decides whether to IK rotate body to match ground angle.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.DontRenderThisFrame
member.summary: Forces to stop rendering this frame (for example - drive task can stop s rendering inside buses).

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.BlockMovementAnims
member.summary: Completely disables processing of on-foot movement anim blending for this frame.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ZeroDesiredMoveBlendRatios
member.summary: Zeroes out all inputs to movement system this frame, causing to stop moving.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.DontChangeMbrInSimpleMoveDoNothing
member.summary: If this is set, then `TaskSimpleMoveDoNothing` will not reset desired move blend ratio to zero this frame.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.FollowingRoute
member.summary: Whether this is following a route of some sort - used to let simplest goto task pull the back onto their current route segment.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.TakingRouteSplineCorner
member.summary: Whether the is cornering via a spline curve, which will take them off their route line segment.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ProcessPhysicsTasks
member.summary: Indicates if the needs to call process physics for (main) tasks this frame.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ProcessPreRender2
member.summary: Indicates if the needs to call `ProcessPreRender2` for tasks.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.FiringWeapon
member.summary: Set when fires any weapon, so script can check the flag.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.SearchingForCover
member.summary: Set if the is likely to be searching for cover, used by the navmesh to load coverpoints around interested s.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.KeepCoverPoint
member.summary: Set if the wants to keep their current cover point this frame, otherwise it gets released.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.IsClimbing
member.summary: If the is climbing, shimmying or on a ladder. Stops `ProcessProbes()` from happening.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.IsJumping
member.summary: Is the jumping.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.IsLanding
member.summary: Is landing after being in the air.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.CullExtraFarAway
member.summary: Flag AI can set to make get culled further away (used for roadblock cops, criminals...)

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.TaskUseKinematicPhysics
member.summary: For use by tasks - puts the into Kinematic physics mode. In this mode the will push other objects our of the way, but not be physically affected by them.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.TemporarilyBlockWeaponSwitching
member.summary: Stops weapon switch processing.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.DoNotClampFootIK
member.summary: Stops clamping the foot IK. Maybe the clamps should be parameters of the IK manager, but apparently that is to be refactored in future
member.remarks: The canonical name is `CPED_RESET_FLAG_DoNotClampFootIk`.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.MoveBlend_bFleeTaskRunning
member.summary: `TASK_SMART_FLEE`, or `TASK_COMPLEX_LEAVE_CAR_AND_FLEE`

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.IsAiming
member.summary: `TASK_GUN` or `TASK_USE_COVER`

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.MoveBlend_bTaskComplexGunRunning
member.summary: `TASK_COMPLEX_GUN` (only)

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.MoveBlend_bMeleeTaskRunning
member.summary: `TASK_COMPLEX_MELEE`

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.MoveBlend_bCopSearchTaskRunning
member.summary: `TASK_COMPLEX_SEARCH_FOR_PED_ON_FOOT`

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.PatrollingInVehicle
member.summary: is patrolling in a , likely meaning they are swat or police.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.IsWalkingRoundPlayer
member.summary: Whether this is walking around another (one frame latency).

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.VisemeAnimsBlocked
member.summary: Blocks viseme anims from playing.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.AmbientAnimsBlocked
member.summary: Blocks new ambient idles from starting.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ApplyVelocityDirectly
member.summary: Indicates if the should apply the velocity directly to the physics collider or go through the force solver.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.DisablePlayerLockOn
member.remarks: The canonical name is `CPED_RESET_FLAG_DisablePlayerLockon`.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ResetMoveGroupAfterRagdoll
member.summary: If , will reset the temp anim group when not ragdolling.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.DisablePedConstraints
member.summary: Allow the to rotate around freely.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.DisablePlayerJumping
member.summary: Disables player jumping if . Reset in `ResetPostPhysics`, as it will be set via script.
member.remarks: Does not disable climbing.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.DisablePlayerVaulting
member.summary: Disables player vaulting/climbing if .
member.remarks: Does not disable auto-vault, but you can disable it with .

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.DisableAsleepImpulse
member.summary: Disable the code that pushes s which fall asleep in the air.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.PostCameraAnimUpdateUseZeroTimestep
member.remarks: The canonical name is `CPED_RESET_FLAG_ePostCameraAnimUpdateUseZeroTimestep`.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.AllowUpdateIfNoCollisionLoaded
member.summary: Don't freeze the for not having bounds loaded around it.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.PlacingCharge
member.summary: Setting Bomb (firing weapon is set also).

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ScriptDisableSecondaryAnimationTasks
member.summary: Disable upper body animation tasks such as shove and open door anims.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.SuppressGunfireEvents
member.summary: Suppresses AI generating fire events, so civilians won't be shocked or react, for use in a shooting range for example.
member.remarks: The canonical name is `CPED_RESET_FLAG_SupressGunfireEvents`.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.InfiniteStamina
member.summary: Currently just for mounts, but could be expanded to anything with stamina.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.BlockWeaponReactionsUnlessDead
member.summary: Stops ragdoll and NM behaviors triggering from weapon damage unless the has died.
member.remarks: Does not block explosion reactions.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ForcePlayerFiring
member.summary: Forces player to fire even if they aren't pressing fire.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.InCoverFacingLeft
member.summary: Set when exiting the cover state saying if the is facing left.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ForcePeekFromCover
member.summary: If set the will go into peeking if they are already in cover.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.NotAllowedToChangeCrouchState
member.summary: If set the will not be allowed to change their crouch state.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ForcePedToStrafe
member.summary: Forces a to strafe.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ForceMeleeStrafingAnims
member.summary: Forces a to use the melee strafing anims when strafing.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.UseKinematicPhysics
member.summary: To be used by scripts - puts the into Kinematic physics mode. In this mode, the will push other physical objects our of the way, but not be physically affected by them.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ClearLockOnTarget
member.summary: Clears the player's lock-on target next frame.
member.remarks: The canonical name is `CPED_RESET_FLAG_ClearLockonTarget`.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.CanPedSeeHatedPedBeingUsed
member.summary: Activates can see hated generating events even when blocking of non-temp events is on.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.InstantBlendToAim
member.summary: Makes the perform an instant blend to aim if starting a gun task this frame.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ForceImprovedIdleTurns
member.summary: Forces the to use an improved idle turning system that should help him turn to face more quickly.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.HitPedWithWeapon
member.summary: Set when damage is inflicted by this on another .

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ForcePedToUseScriptCamHeading
member.summary: Forces a to the scripted camera heading instead of gameplay.
member.remarks: The canonical name is `CPED_RESET_FLAG_ForcePedToUseScripCamHeading`.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ProcessProbesWhenExtractingZ
member.summary: Makes the capsule physics push the out of the ground even when extracting Z.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.KeepDesiredCoverPoint
member.summary: Should the keep their desired cover point this frame.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.HasProcessedCornering
member.summary: Whether the has already processed slowing down for this corner.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.StandingOnForkliftForks
member.summary: Set when the standing capsule hits the forklift forks.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.AimWeaponReactionRunning
member.summary: is running the reaction task this frame.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.InContactWithFoliage
member.summary: is in contact with `GTA_FOLIAGE_TYPE` bounds.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ForceExplosionCollisions
member.summary: will always collide with explosions, even when collision is off.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.IgnoreTargetsCoverForLos
member.summary: When checking LOS against targets, this will ignore their cover (if the cover exists).
member.remarks: The canonical name is `CPED_RESET_FLAG_IgnoreTargetsCoverForLOS`.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.BlockAnimatedWeaponReactions
member.summary: should not play animated damager reactions while this flag is set.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.DisablePedCapsule

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.DisableCrouchWhileInCover
member.summary: Force the crouch flag to return while in cover.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.IncreasedAvoidanceRadius
member.summary: Adds extra 2m onto the radius other s use to avoid this during local steering.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ForceRunningSpeedForFragSmashing
member.summary: Forces the to apply forces to frags as if running on contact, to guarantee s will smash through frag objects when playing custom anims. Can be set by level designers to force the to smash more easily through frags.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.EnableMoverAnimationWhileAttached
member.summary: While flagged, any mover animation will be applied to the offset of the attachment.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.NoTimeDelayBeforeShot
member.summary: While flagged, The time delay before a player can fire after aiming is 0.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.SearchingForAutoVaultClimb
member.summary: Informs climb code the is doing an auto-vault.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ExtraLongWeaponRange
member.summary: Extends the range of a s weapons to 250m.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.ForcePlayerToEnterVehicleThroughDirectDoorOnly
member.summary: Forces the player to only use direct access when entering s.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.TaskCullExtraFarAway
member.summary: Can be set by AI tasks on the main task tree to disable a getting cull from a .

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.IsVaulting
member.summary: Set the entire time `CTaskVault` is running.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.IsParachuting
member.summary: Set the entire time `CTaskParachute` is running.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.SuppressSlowingForCorners
member.summary: If set, this will prevent the from slowing down to take corners this frame.

member.name: F:GTA.PedResetFlagToggles.DisableProcessProbes
member.summary: Disables processing of probes.

member.name: T:GTA.RagdollBlockingFlags
member.summary: An enumeration of possible flags used to disable ragdoll behaviors from various sources.

member.name: F:GTA.RagdollBlockingFlags.PlayerImpact
member.summary: Blocks ragdoll activation from any impact with a (player characters running into the , or active ragdolls colliding with them).

member.name: F:GTA.RagdollBlockingFlags.AllowBlockDeadPed
member.summary: Allows blocking of ragdoll activation for dead s. By default, dead s' ragdolls are allowed to activate regardless of how these flags have been set.

member.name: F:GTA.RagdollBlockingFlags.PlayerBump
member.summary: Blocks ragdoll activation from an animated player running into the character (but not from collisions with other ragdolls).

member.name: F:GTA.RagdollBlockingFlags.PlayerRagdollBump
member.summary: Blocks ragdoll activation from a ragdolling player colliding with the character (but not from animated player bumps or collisions with active non-player ragdolls).

member.name: F:GTA.RagdollBlockingFlags.PedRagdollBump
member.summary: Blocks ragdoll activation from a ragdolling non-player colliding with the character (but not from any collisions with players, ragdolling or otherwise).

member.name: F:GTA.RagdollBlockingFlags.VehicleGrab
member.summary: Blocks ragdoll activation from grabbing a door whilst it pulls away.

member.name: T:GTA.RagdollComponent
member.summary: The ragdoll component enum, which is used for apply force natives and some config files such as physicstasks.ymt.

member.name: T:GTA.RagdollFallType
member.summary: An enumeration of most of the possible values for .
member.remarks: Most of the values listed are named after the values of the enum eRagdollType, which is used in RagdollType in pedbounds.xml.

member.name: F:GTA.RagdollFallType.FallToDeath
member.summary: Behaves similar to , but the will be killed after a ragdoll fall task ends (by a CEventDeath).

member.name: F:GTA.RagdollType.Relax
member.summary: s will fall with their muscle relax, just like when s' healths are set to zero and get killed by setting the healths.

member.name: F:GTA.RagdollType.ScriptControl
member.summary: You can control s' ragdoll behaviors by additional configurations. Consider using the class for advanced and easier ragdoll configurations.

member.name: F:GTA.RagdollType.Balance
member.summary: s will try to balance.

member.name: F:GTA.ScriptTaskStatus.WaitingToStart
member.summary: The task is issued to the as a primary task but they're waiting for events or other tasks preventing them from performing it to end. Eg. When the task is issued while the is ragdolling or reacting a shocking event such as a agitating event, or when an animation task is issued while they are being dragged from their (and the animation task is primary one).

member.summary: Task is currently being performed by the as a primary task.

member.name: F:GTA.ScriptTaskStatus.Dormant
member.summary: The task is dormant because it's temporarily interrupted by some events or other tasks. Eg. When the is stumbling since another bumped them after the task had started at all.

member.name: F:GTA.ScriptTaskStatus.Vacant
member.summary: The script task has nothing to do. basically goes to this status.

member.name: F:GTA.ScriptTaskStatus.Finished

member.name: M:GTA.Style.ReleasePreloadVariationData
member.summary: Releases the assets set with .
member.remarks: Note that variation data set with counts towards the script memory budget of the SHVDN runtime script. For this reason, it is important to use this method to release these assets as soon as you don't need them anymore. In fact, you can call this method as soon as you have set the same variation with since at that point the assets will be rendered on the ped and have references to keep them in memory.

member.name: M:GTA.PedMoveNetworkTaskInterface.SetSignalFloatLerpRate(System.String,System.Single)

summary.para: Sets the lerp rate to the passed value.
Only available in the game version v1.0.1493.0 and later.

member.remarks: Lerp rate controls rate at which the corresponding MoVE float signal will lerp over frame updates on the clone from the current value to the target value. It is assumed that the corresponding MoVE float signal has already been created using . Currently the lerp rate defaults to a value of `0.5f`. The lerp value has to be above `0.0f` and below `1.0f`. If a lerp rate of `1.0f` is applied then no lerping is used and the exact float value will be synced and applied immediately on the clone.

member.summary: Forces the to jump.
member.param: If , the will do super jump. Internally, the super jump and the beast jump flags will be used for a new CTaskJumpVault. Does nothing in (probably) v1.0.505.2 or earlier game versions.

If and is as well, the super jump height will be doubled. Internally, the super jump and the beast jump flags will be used for a new CTaskJumpVault (even if is ). Does nothing in (probably) v1.0.505.2 or earlier game versions.

member.name: M:GTA.TaskInvoker.Climb
member.summary: Tells the to perform the climb task (CTaskJumpVault).
member.remarks: The needs to be positioned and oriented so that a jump will locate an edge for the ped to grab. If an edge cant be found, the ped will just do a normal jump and land. If an edge can be found then the ped will climb and then stand on top of the found edge.

member.name: M:GTA.TaskInvoker.ClimbLadder(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tells the to perform a climb ladder task (CTaskClimbLadderFully).
member.remarks: The task decides whether the is supposed to climb or descend by examining which end of the ladder is nearest. The needs to be positioned right next to the ladder they are supposed to use, and should also be facing it. There are two possibilities for mounting the ladder - at the base of the ladder facing towards the front of it, and at the top of the ladder facing the reverse of the ladder. If successful, the will get on the ladder, climb, and then get off.

member.summary: Puts the into melee.
member.param: The target.
The blend time in second. will make the into melee instantly from the previous motion such as walking. To precisely mimic how long general game code blends a into melee, use .

param.name: strafePhaseSync
param.para: Typically 0f is used, but 10f is used in all of the occurrences where 8f is used for in fbi4_prep1.ysc.

Not exactly known how this parameter affects the motion strafing task (CTaskMotionStrafing), but at least this sets a field of CTaskMotionPed in TASK_PUT_PED_DIRECTLY_INTO_MELEE, which is soon read by a created CTaskMotionStrafing and will be used for a rage::fwMoveNetworkPlayer that can be accessed from a CTaskMotionStrafing instance.

member.remarks: Implicitly sets for the created CTaskThreatResponse if called on an AI/NPC .

member.name: M:GTA.TaskInvoker.FollowNavMeshTo(GTA.Math.Vector3,System.Nullable{GTA.PedMoveBlendRatio},System.Int32,System.Single,GTA.FollowNavMeshFlags,System.Single)
member.summary: Tells the to follow the navmesh to the given coord.
member.param: The position to go to.
Specifies how much fast the ped will move. If , the value will default to 2f.
The time before warping in milliseconds.
An Unknown radius parameter (possibly the radius for navmesh search) but does not affect the distance where the ped will stop.
The navigation flags.
The final heading that the will turn to at the end of the task. Leave to leave as is.
member.remarks: Sometimes a path may not be able to be found. This could happen because there simply isn't any way to get there, or maybe a bunch of dynamic objects have blocked the way, or maybe the destination is too far away. In this case the will simply stand still. To identify when this has happened, you can use . This will help you find situations where cannot get to their target.

member.name: M:GTA.TaskInvoker.GoToPointAnyMeansExtraParamsWithCruiseSpeed(GTA.Math.Vector3,GTA.PedMoveBlendRatio,GTA.Vehicle,System.Boolean,GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,GTA.TaskGoToPointAnyMeansFlags,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Tells the to go to a point by any means.
member.param: The target point.
The move blend ratio.

The vehicle to get to the point. Set to let the use any s. If a instance is set that does not exist in the game, the method will silently fail without even creating a CTaskGoToPointAnyMeans, which is supposed to be created.

If , the created task may use a CTaskVehicleGotoLongRange, which automatically loads nodes in the background (may be useful to avoid the task not going to a point when you want to get s to a point far from where the player is). If , the created task will not use a CTaskVehicleGotoLongRange, which may result in the task not going to a point if the specified point is too far from where the player is.
The driving flags.
The max range to shoot targets in meters.

param.name: extraVehToTargetDistToPreferVeh
param.para: The distance in meters that partially determines if the stops considering when they are not in a . The high this value is, the further the will stop considering from . Roughly speaking, if this parameter is more than the square of the distance between the and , they will not basically take any s.

Strictly speaking, the distance between a and and this parameter is less than or equal to the sum of the distance between the and and the square root, the task will stop considering the .
You can confirm if it is correct that how exactly this parameter works that explained in this document by searching for "76 04 B0 01 EB 79 0F 28 9A ? ? ? ? F3 0F 59 ED" and inspecting nearby instructions, where rcx is the pointer to a CTaskGoToPointAnyMeans, rdx is the pointer to a considered CVehicle, and r8 is the pointer to the CPed who is executing the rcx task.

member.param: The distance to target in meters at which the will start driving straight instead of following vehicle nodes.
The extra flags for how the created task should be executed.
The cruise speed in m/s.
The distance to target in meters at which a vehicle task will quit.

member.name: M:GTA.TaskInvoker.Pause(System.Int32)

summary.para: Tasks the to do nothing for the specified amount of milliseconds. Typically used as a part of to add a delay. CTaskDoNothing will be issued when this method is called as a standalone task and CTaskPause will be issued when this method is called as a part of .
Some tasks such as CTaskMeleeActionResult, which is caused by doing melee attacks, may stop immediately when this task is issued as a part of , which is different from .

member.param: The duration in milliseconds.
member.remarks: Unlike , if no script (including ysc ones or external ones) owns the , which is possible by creating them or calling , the will stop doing a pause task immediately and do an ambient task instead.

member.name: M:GTA.TaskInvoker.StandStill(System.Int32)

summary.para: Tasks the to stand still for the specified amount of milliseconds. Typically used as a part of to add a stand still task (internally CTaskDoNothing will always be issued).
Some tasks such as CTaskMeleeActionResult, which is caused by doing melee attacks, may not stop immediately when this task is issued, which is different from .

member.param: The duration in milliseconds.
member.remarks: Unlike , the won't stop doing a pause task even if no script (including ysc ones or external ones) owns the , which is possible by creating them or calling .

member.name: M:GTA.TaskInvoker.StartScenarioInPlace(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Puts this into the given scenario immediately in place.
member.param: The scenario name.

param.name: timeToLeave
param.para: The time in milliseconds since the starts the main clip of the scenario before they starts to leave.
If zero, the initiated task will not have the leave the scenario by elapsing time.
If positive, the initiated task will have the leave the scenario after the specified time elapsed.

If negative, the initiated task will will not stop the leaving the scenario by elapsing time (behaves the same as zero in this way) but this method will start a CTaskUseScenario task with "idle forever" flag (although it is unknown what difference the flag makes).

member.param: If , the initiated task will skip the enter clip.
member.remarks: This method will not start a CTask and the will do nothing for the CTask if the scenario manager does not have the registered hash for .

If zero, the initiated task will not have the leave the scenario by elapsing time.
If positive, the initiated task will have the leave the scenario after the specified time elapsed.

If negative, the initiated task will will not stop the leaving the scenario by elapsing time (behaves the same as zero in this way) but this method will start a CTaskUseScenario task with "idle forever" flag (although it is unknown what difference the flag makes).

member.param: If , the initiated task will skip the enter clip.
If , the initiated task will warp the rather than tell them to go to the position themselves.
member.remarks: This method will not start a CTask and the will do nothing for the CTask if the scenario manager does not have the registered hash for .

The distance in meters at which the AI thinks the target has been reached and the car stops. To pick default value 4f, the parameter can be passed in as -1 or any other values less than zero.

The distance in meters at which the AI switches to heading for the target directly instead of following the nodes. The max acceptable value is 255, or the value will be clamp to 255 by the native function TASK_VEHICLE_MISSION. To pick default value 20f, the parameter can be passed in as -1 or any other values less than zero.
if set to , allows the car to drive on the opposite side of the road into incoming traffic.

The distance how far the will keep the distance between in meters. If less than zero, the following value will be used as a fallback in the created task:
If is either or , always 5 meters is used as a fallback regardless of the vehicle type (). To test if the fall back value is correct for front or rear escort types, search a dumped exe for 0F 28 46 ? F3 0F 10 8B ? ? 00 00 0F 2F 0D ? ? ? ? 0F 29 45 ? 73 08.
If is either or , one of the following three fallback values will be used and the vehicle type () determines this. Fallback values:
For helicopters, blimp, and autogyro types, which are , , and , 15 meters.
For motorcycle type (), 1.4 meters. This does not include bicycle type ().
For any vehicle types other than, heli, blimp, motorcycle, and autogyro, 2 meters. Do note that this fallback value applies for plane type .
To test if the fall back value is correct for left or right escort types, search a dumped exe for 0F 57 F6 0F 2F FE 44 0F 28 C6 73 32.
The fallback values are subject to change by game updates.
Only used for helicopters. The height in meters that the heli will try to stay above terrain (i.e. 20 == always tries to stay at least 20 meters above ground).
The distance to target in meters at which the will start driving straight instead of following vehicle nodes.

Specifies whether to tell the plane to move precisely with VTOL. If and the plane supports VTOL, the plane will use VTOL and set the vertical flight nozzles position to the position for vertical flight. If and the plane supports VTOL, the plane will not use VTOL and set the vertical flight nozzles position to the position for horizontal flight. If the plane does not support VTOL, this parameter has no effect.

member.summary: Resume the enter vehicle task even if the task is interrupted (bumped, shot).

member.summary: Warp the to entry point ready to open the door/enter seat.

member.name: F:GTA.EnterVehicleFlags.JackAnyone
member.summary: Allow the to jack regardless of relationship status if they have to jack someone to complete the enter vehicle task. Without this flag, the won't jack those they respect or like where the relationship is set to or towards them, but may jack those they don't respect or like. Without this flag, the will abort the enter vehicle task if they have to jack one of those who respect or like to complete the enter vehicle task.

member.name: F:GTA.EnterVehicleFlags.WarpIn
member.summary: Warp the onto the .

member.summary: Dont close the vehicle door.

member.name: F:GTA.EnterVehicleFlags.WarpIfDoorIsBlocked
member.summary: Allow ped to warp to the seat if entry is blocked. If the shuffle link to that seat is blocked by someone but the entry point for the shuffle link is not directly blocked, the won't warp. Consider using if you want the to warp when the direct door and the shuffle link to that seat is blocked by someone.

member.name: F:GTA.EnterVehicleFlags.UseLeftEntry
member.summary: Use entry/exit point on the left hand side.

member.name: F:GTA.EnterVehicleFlags.UseRightEntry
member.summary: Use entry/exit point on the right hand side.

member.summary: When jacking just open the door and/or pull the ped out, but don't get in.

member.name: F:GTA.EnterVehicleFlags.BlockSeatShuffling
member.summary: Disable shuffling, forcing ped to use direct door only.

member.name: F:GTA.EnterVehicleFlags.WarpIfShuffleLinkIsBlocked
member.summary: Allow ped to warp if the direct door is blocked and the shuffle link to that seat is blocked by someone. Unlike , this flag allows the the to warp when the direct door and the shuffle link to that seat is blocked by someone (regardless of whether the door linked to the shuffle link is directly blocked).

member.name: T:GTA.ProjectileThrown
member.summary: Represents a thrown projectile, which is for `CProjectileThrown`.
member.remarks: Unlike `CProjectileRocket`, `CProjectileThrown` only overrides `CObject::GetAsProjectileThrown` (both const and non-const variants) and `CProjectile::GetInfo` (which returns `CAmmoProjectileInfo`). `CProjectileThrown` does not have additional members or functions, either.
