member.name: T:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags
member.summary: An enumeration of possible flags used for the synchronized scene task `CTaskSynchronizedScene`.

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.UseKinematicPhysics
member.summary: When this flag is set, the task will run in kinematic physics mode (other entities will collide, and be pushed out of the way).

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.TagSyncOut
member.summary: When this flag is set, The task will do a tag synchronized blend out with the movement behaviour of the .

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.DontInterrupt
member.summary: When this flag is set, the scene will not be interrupted by ai events like falling, entering water / etc. Also blocks all weapon reactions / etc.

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.OnAbortStopScene
member.summary: When this flag is set, the entire scene will be stopped if this task is aborted.

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.AbortOnWeaponDamage
member.summary: When this flag is set, the task will end if the takes weapon damage.

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.BlockMoverUpdate
member.summary: When this flag is set, the task will not update the mover. Can be used to include vehicles in a synced scene when the scene is attached to them.

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.LoopWithinScene
member.summary: When this flag is set, the tasks with anims shorter than the scene will loop while the scene is playing.

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.PreserveVelocity
member.summary: When this flag is set, the task will preserve it's velocity on clean up (must be using physics).

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.ExpandPedCapsuleFromSkeleton
member.summary: When this flag is set, the capsule will attempt to expand to cover the skeleton during playback.

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.ActivateRagdollOnCollision
member.summary: When this flag is set, the will switch to ragdoll and fall down on making contact with a physical object (other than flat ground).

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.HideWeapon
member.summary: When this flag is set, the 's weapon will be hidden while the scene is playing.

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.AbortOnDeath
member.summary: When this flag is set, the task will end if the dies.

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.VehicleAbortOnLargeImpact
member.summary: When running the scene on a vehicle, allow the scene to abort if the vehicle takes a heavy collision from another vehicle.

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.VehicleAllowPlayerEntry
member.summary: When running the scene on a vehicle, allow player s to enter the vehicle.

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.ProcessAttachmentsOnStart
member.summary: When this flag is set, process the attachments at the start of the scene.

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.NetOnEarlyNonPedStopReturnToStart
member.summary: When this flag is set, a non- entity will be returned to their starting position if the scene finishes early.

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.SetPedOutOfVehicleAtStart
member.summary: When this flag is set, the will be automatically set out of their at the start of the scene.

member.name: F:GTA.SyncedSceneFlags.NetDisregardAttachmentChecks
member.summary: When this flag is set, the attachment checks done in `CNetworkSynchronisedScenes::Update` when pending start will be disregarded.

member.name: T:GTA.BikeHandlingData
member.summary: Represents the bike handling data class for CBikeHandlingData, which is for motorcycles, quad bikes (also trikes), and bicycles. All the values this class exposes are available in all game versions.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.LeanForwardCenterOfMassMultiplier
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating how much the center of mass is shifted by leaning forward in meters.
member.value: The value indicating how much the center of mass is shifted by leaning forward in meters.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.LeanForwardForceMultiplier
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating how much force is applied when leaning forward.
member.value: The value indicating how much force is applied when leaning forward.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.LeanBackCenterOfMassMultiplier
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating how much the center of mass is shifted by leaning backward in meters.
member.value: The value indicating how much the center of mass is shifted by leaning backward in meters.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.LeanBackwardForceMultiplier
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating how much force is applied when leaning backward.
member.value: The value indicating how much force is applied when leaning backward.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.MaxBankAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets The max angle of bike lean when cornering in radians.
member.value: The max angle of bike lean when cornering in radians.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.FullAnimAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle where the driver's body starts to fully lean when cornering.
member.value: The angle where the driver's body starts to fully lean when cornering in radians.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.DesLeanReturnFraction
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating how slowly the driver body lean changes by steering.
member.value: The value indicating how much slowly the driver body lean changes by steering.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.StickLeanMultiplier
member.summary: Gets or sets the multiplier indicating how quickly the bike leans by steering.
member.value: The multiplier indicating how quickly the bike leans by steering.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.BrakingStabilityMultiplier
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for brake bias/balance value. If this value is negative, the bike will have rear brake bias. This value has effect even when there is no steer input.
member.value: The value for brake bias/balance value.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.InAirSteerMultiplier
member.summary: Gets or sets the strength multiplier of in-air steering (which applies when no tires are touching surface). This value should be negative to let the bike steer just like when it's on ground and let the bike upside up when the driver is not leaning forward or backward. Pitch input still works even when this value is zero, but the bike will try to get upside down when this value is positive.
member.value: The value for brake bias/balance value.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.WheelieBalancePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that affects how much x-axis rotation is needed in radians before an additional positive x-Axis angular force applies to the bike, which will keep the bike from easily wheelieing more. Only affects when the bike is wheelieing. Should be positive to not let the bike easily wheelie more than a certain angle, but easily wheelie to the specified angle. The more the difference is, the more positive x-Axis angular force the bike will receive.
member.remarks: The formula (float)Math.Asin(Vector3.Dot(Vehicle.ForwardVector, VehicleWheel.SurfaceNormalVector)) - fWheelieBalancePoint (where the deg to rad conversion has been already applied to fWheelieBalancePoint) determines whether to apply negative x-Axis angular force. If the result is more than 0.05, an additional positive x-Axis angular force will be applied.
member.value: The value that affects how much x-axis rotation is needed before an additional positive x-Axis angular force applies to the bike when the bike is wheelieing in radians.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.StoppieBalancePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that affects how much x-axis rotation is needed in radians before an additional negative x-Axis angular force applies to the bike, which will keep the bike from easily stoppieing more. Only affects when the bike is stoppieing. Should be negative to not let the bike stoppie wheelie more than a certain angle, but easily stoppie to the specified angle. The more the difference is, the more negative x-Axis angular force the bike will receive.
member.remarks: The formula (float)Math.Asin(Vehicle.ForwardVector.Z) - fStoppieBalancePoint (where the deg to rad conversion has been already applied to fStoppieBalancePoint) determines whether to apply negative x-Axis angular force. If the result is less than -0.05, an additional negative x-Axis angular force will be applied. Unlike wheelieing, the normal vector of the wheel does not affect in physics for stopping at all.
member.value: The value that affects how much x-axis rotation is needed before an additional negative x-Axis angular force applies to the bike when the bike is stoppieing in radians.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.WheelieSteerMultiplier
member.summary: Gets or sets the multiplier for steering when wheelieing. Should be negative.
member.value: The multiplier for steering when wheelieing.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.RearBalanceMultiplier
member.summary: Gets or sets An unknown multiplier for rear balance that have effects only when wheelieing. Should be positive.
member.value: An unknown multiplier for rear balance that have effects only when wheelieing.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.FrontBalanceMultiplier
member.summary: Gets or sets An unknown multiplier for front balance that have effects only when stopping. Should be positive.
member.value: An unknown multiplier for front balance that have effects only when stopping.

member.name: P:GTA.BikeHandlingData.BikeOnStandLeanAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the lean angle in radians indicating how much the bike should be lean on stand or in very low speed. Should be negative to match the standing animation.
member.value: The lean angle in radians indicating how much the bike should be lean on stand or in very low speed.

summary.para: This class has most regular handling data. Currently compatible with 1.0.2060.0 or later.

Note that this class gets data from or sets data to the CHandlingData instance as is, and thus not all the handling values don't match the equivalent values in the handling.meta file. The game multiplies or divides some values after reading values from the handling.meta file.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.MemoryAddress
member.summary: Gets the memory address where the is stored in memory.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.IsValid
member.summary: Returns true if this is valid.
member.value: if this is valid; otherwise, .

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.AntiRollBarBiasFront
member.summary: Gets or sets the bias between front and rear for the anti-roll bar. This value will be set to the equivalent value in the handling.meta multiplied by 2 when instances are initialized.
member.value: The anti roll bar bias front. 0.0f is fully front, 2.0f is fully rear.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.AntiRollBarForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the spring constant that is transmitted to the opposite wheel when under compression. Larger numbers result in a larger force being applied.
member.value: The anti roll bar force.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.ClutchChangeRateScaleDownShift
member.summary: Gets or sets the clutch speed multiplier on down shifts.
member.value: The clutch speed multiplier on down shifts.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.ClutchChangeRateScaleUpShift
member.summary: Gets or sets the clutch speed multiplier on up shifts.
member.value: The clutch speed multiplier on up shifts.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.DownForceModifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of downforce applied to the vehicle.
member.value: The amount of downforce applied to the vehicle.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.DriveBiasFront

summary.para: Gets or sets how much the vehicle gives rear axles force. The rest of the force will be given to front axles. This value will be set to the equivalent value in the handling.meta multiplied by 2 when instances are initialized.
0.0 is rear wheel drive, 2.0 is front wheel drive, and any value between 0.01 and 0.199 is four wheel drive (1.0 give both front and rear axles equal force, being perfect 4WD.)

member.value: The percent the vehicle gives rear axles force (between 0.0 to 2.0).

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.DriveInertia
member.summary: Gets or sets the drive inertia that determines how fast the engine acceleration is.
member.value: The drive inertia.
member.remarks: If you want a vehicle with high torque but slow acceleration (e.g. a truck), lower the driver inertia and specify a high drive force.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.InitialDragCoefficient
member.summary: Gets or sets the drag coefficient.
member.value: The drag coefficient.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.InitialDriveForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the power engine produces in top gear.
member.value: The power engine that produces in top gear.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.InitialDriveGears
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of gears (excluding reverse).
member.value: The number of gears (excluding reverse).

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.InitialDriveMaxVelocity
member.summary: Determines the speed at redline in high gear in m/s that provides CTransmission of new s with this ; Controls the final drive of the vehicle's gearbox.
member.value: the speed at redline in high gear.

remarks.para: This value is initially set to [the value of `fInitialDriveMaxFlatVel`] / 3.6f * 1.2f, where fInitialDriveMaxFlatVel is read from a handling.meta.

Setting this value does not guarantee the vehicle will reach this speed. Setting this value does not change the speed at redline in high gear of existing s with this , as it is the CTransmission on a CVehicle that actually determines the speed at redline in high gear of a .

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.InitialDriveMaxFlatVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial drive max velocity in m/s. This is read when s are driving, but it is unknown that how exactly this value affects.
member.value: the speed at redline in high gear in m/s.
member.remarks: This value is initially set to [the value of `fInitialDriveMaxFlatVel`] / 3.6f, where fInitialDriveMaxFlatVel is read from a handling.meta.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.LowSpeedTractionLossMultiplier
member.summary: How much traction is reduced at low speed, 0.0 means normal traction. It affects mainly car burnout (spinning wheels when car doesn't move) when pressing gas. Decreasing value will cause less burnout, less sliding at start. However, the higher value, the more burnout car gets.
member.value: How much traction is reduced at low speed.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.Mass
member.summary: Gets or sets the weight.
member.value: The weight in Kilograms.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.OilVolume
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of oil.
member.value: The amount of oil.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.PercentSubmerged
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage of the "floating height" after it falls into the water, before sinking.
member.value: The percentage between 0 and 1.
member.remarks: The default value for vanilla land vehicles is 0.85. The value will stop sinking the vehicle to float for a moment before sinking. An invalid number will cause the vehicle to sink without the driver drowning.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.PetrolTankVolume
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of petrol that will leak after damaging a vehicle's tank.
member.value: The amount of petrol.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.PetrolConsumptionRate
member.summary: Gets or Sets the rate at which a vehicle consumes petrol (gasoline).
member.value: The petrol consumption rate.

remarks.para: The default value in vanilla handling.meta files is 0.5f.
There is a good chance that this attribute may be used in missions where there is a script that changes the gas level of the vehicle.
It should probably be used more frequently to adjust how fast the vehicle's petrol leaks.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.PopUpLightRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation values in degree the parts pop-up headlights needs to be rotated when headlights are on.
member.value: The rotation values in degree. Can be negative.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.SteeringLock

summary.para: Gets or sets a value that multiplies the game's calculation of the angle of the steer wheel will turn while at full turn in radians. Steering lock is directly related to over/under-steer.
When instances are initialized, the game converts the value in degrees read from handling.meta to radians before this value is initialized.

member.value: The value that multiplies the game's calculation of the angle of the steer wheel in radians, between 0.01 and above.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.SuspensionBiasFront
member.summary: Gets or sets the damping scale bias between front and rear wheels. This value determines which suspension is stronger, front or rear. This value will be set to the equivalent value in the handling.meta multiplied by 2 when instances are initialized.
member.value: The suspension bias front.
member.remarks: if more wheels at back (e.g. trucks), front suspension should be stronger.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.SuspensionCompressionDamping
member.summary: Gets or sets the damping during strut compression. This value will be set to the equivalent value in the handling.meta divided by 10 when instances are initialized.
member.value: The damping during strut compression.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.SuspensionForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the suspension force. Lower limit for zero force at full extension is calculated using (1.0f / (force * number of wheels)).
member.value: The suspension force.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.SuspensionLowerLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets how far the wheels can move down from their original position.
member.value: The suspension lower limit.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.SuspensionRaise
member.summary: Gets or sets the adjustment from artist positioning.
member.value: The suspension raise.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.SuspensionReboundDamping
member.summary: Gets or sets the damping during strut rebound. This value will be set to the equivalent value in the handling.meta divided by 10 when instances are initialized.
member.value: The damping during strut rebound.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.SuspensionUpperLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets how far the wheels can move up from their original position.
member.value: The suspension upper limit.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.TractionBiasFront
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that determines the distribution of traction from front to rear. This value will be set to the equivalent value in the handling.meta multiplied by 2 when instances are initialized.
member.value: The value that determines distribution of traction from front to rear.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.TractionLossMultiplier
member.summary: Gets or sets how much traction is affected by material grip differences from 1.0f.
member.value: The traction loss multiplier.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.TractionSpringDeltaMax
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum distance for traction spring.
member.value: The traction loss multiplier.

member.name: P:GTA.HandlingData.WeaponDamageScaledToVehicleHealthMultiplier
member.summary: Gets of Sets the multiplier for how much damage a vehicle takes from weapons.
member.value: The weapon damage scaling multiplier.

remarks.para: The default value in vanilla handling.meta files is 0.5f.

This attribute scales the amount of damage a vehicle takes based on its remaining health. A vehicle that is nearly destroyed will take less damage from weapons than a fully healthy vehicle. Changing this attribute can affect the vehicle's durability in combat situations.

member.name: T:GTA.VehicleWeaponHandlingData
member.summary: Represents the vehicle weapon handling data class for CVehicleWeaponHandlingData.

remarks.para: You can use up to 6 elements per array for weapons and turrets in v1.0.1180.2 or later game versions (although turret arrays can internally contain up to 12 elements). In the game versions prior to v1.0.1180.2, you can use up to 4 elements per array for weapons and 3 elements per array for turrets.
Resetting vehicle part states will be needed to apply the changes to existing vehicles that use this sub handling data, such as changing vehicle mods or calling .

The exe has the hashed value of HANDLING_TYPE_TRAIN, which is 0xE0F200C3, but it does not have a concrete class for train handling data.

member.name: M:GTA.Vehicle.SetHydraulicsControl(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If disabled, any raised hydraulics are lowered and controls are disabled. If enabled, hydraulics are raised if lowered and controls are enabled. Only available in v1.0.505.2 or later versions.
member.param: Whether to enable this 's hydraulic controls or not.
member.exception: Thrown if called in game versions earlier than v1.0.505.2.

member.name: M:GTA.Vehicle.ForceUseAudioGameObject(System.String)
member.summary: Overrides this 's audio game object with another so the vehicle has different various vehicle sounds such as horn, door, suspension, and start sequences.

param.name: gameObjectName
param.para: The audio game object name. Case insensitive in ASCII characters since the string will be hashed using (almost) the same function as uses.

Generally accepts the internal game name of the to source an audio profile from, such as "sentinel" or "deluxe". All vanilla vehicles use unique game audio objects as of v1.0.2944.0 because none of them have audioNameHash override in vehicles.meta. For mod vehicles, you might want to check if audioNameHash is overridden.

You can use any names listed as items of any audio type of vehicle, boat, bicycle, aeroplane, helicopter, or train. You can find one with the term Item type="[some type]" ("[some type]" can be Vehicle, Boat, Bicycle, Aeroplane, Helicopter, Train) in game.dat[some number].rel in CodeWalker. "BJXL_ARMENIAN_3" and "STRETCH_MICHAEL_4" are registered as the vehicle type for 2 ysc scripts for example and you can use them.

member.name: P:GTA.Vehicle.BodyHealth
member.summary: Gets or sets this s body health.

summary.para: Gets or sets this engine health.
When this value is less than 0.0, the engine will not work.

When this value is between -1000.0 and 0.0 exclusive, the engine is on fire and the value will decrease until it reaches -1000.0. While on fire, burning engine "may" set the petrol tank on fire as well, but there's only a chance of this.
Gets or sets this petrol tank health.
When this value is between -1000.0 and 0.0 exclusive, the petrol tank is on fire and the value will decrease until it reaches -1000.0. The will explode when this health reaches -1000.0.

member.name: P:GTA.Vehicle.IsConsideredDestroyed

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is considered destroyed. Will be set to when s are exploded or sinking for a short time.
will return and will return if this value is set to . Does not affect if this will rendered scorched.

member.remarks: Many features of will be disabled when this value is set to . For example, s cannot enter s considered destroyed or start the engines of them. s cannot use weapons of them. The player cannot unflip s considered destroyed.

member.summary: Applies damage deformation to this . You might want to pass and where the product is larger than 5000 to see a observable result.
member.param: The coordinates where the damage is applied to the .
Scales how much damage is applied to the . Not known whether the outcome will be exactly the same if this parameter and are passed in the reversed order.
Sets how much the vehicle is deformed by (not exactly a radius parameter). Not known whether the outcome will be exactly the same if this parameter and are passed in the reversed order.
If , this method will apply the damage local to the 's space. If , this method will apply the damage in the world space. You would likely set this parameter to in most cases.
member.remarks: Does not deal damage to any health values.

member.name: M:GTA.Vehicle.GetRestrictedAmmoCount(System.Int32)

summary.para: Gets the current restricted ammo count for a particular vehicle weapon index on this . When the restricted ammo count is set positive, the game will count down with every fire and prevent firing at 0.

Not available in v1.0.877.1 or earlier game versions due to absence of members for restricted ammo counts in CVehicle. Currently not available in v1.0.944.2 due to absence of GET_VEHICLE_WEAPON_RESTRICTED_AMMO.

member.param: The weapon index, corresponds to each weapon slot in the vehicle's handling.meta. The valid range is between 0 and 5 since the game version v1.0.1180.2, between 0 and 4 in the game version between v1.0.944.2 and v1.0.1103.2. you can see what weapon hashes the weapon sub handling data specifies with .
member.returns: The current restricted ammo count for specified weapon index if the exists and the weapon index is valid (can be a negative value other than -1); otherwise, -1, which is the same as the default value set when the just spawned.
member.exception: Thrown when called in v1.0.944.2 or earlier game versions.

member.name: M:GTA.Vehicle.SetRestrictedAmmoCount(System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: Sets the current restricted ammo count for a particular vehicle weapon index on this .
Not available in v1.0.877.1 or earlier game versions due to absence of members for restricted ammo counts in CVehicle.

member.param: The weapon index, corresponds to each weapon slot in the vehicle's handling.meta. The valid range is between 0 and 5 since the game version v1.0.1180.2, between 0 and 4 in the game version between v1.0.944.2 and v1.0.1103.2. you can see what weapon hashes the weapon sub handling data specifies with .

When set positive, will count down with every fire and prevent firing at 0. Set -1 (or another negative value) to disable restricted ammo, which will result in the same result as when the just spawned.
member.exception: Thrown when called in v1.0.877.1 or earlier game versions.

member.name: P:GTA.Vehicle.BombAmmoCount

summary.para: Sets the current bomb ammo count on this , which does not make the game prevent from using bombs but can be read/write across scripts.
Not available in v1.0.1103.2 or earlier game versions.

member.remarks: Unlike restricted vehicle ammo (which is game code fired), this is script-fired and manually decremented, and only stored in vehicle code for network sync purposes. Therefore, you need to manage this property in your scripts on your own.

member.name: P:GTA.Vehicle.CountermeasureAmmoCount

summary.para: Sets the current countermeasure ammo count on this , which does not make the game prevent from using bombs but can be read/write across scripts.
Not available in v1.0.1103.2 or earlier game versions.

member.remarks: Unlike restricted vehicle ammo (which is game code fired), this is script-fired and manually decremented, and only stored in vehicle code for network sync purposes. Therefore, you need to manage this property in your scripts on your own.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleLockStatus.CannotEnterIfDriverExists
member.summary: For players, the cannot open any door if it has a driver. For AI, entering vehicle tasks will not start if the target 's lock status is set to this value and the has a driver.

remarks.para: When a is about to open the 's door or the 's driver instance is changed, the lock status will be set to .
AI s can still get the driver out of the to kill the driver, while players cannot do that even if given a task.

summary.para: Can be broken into the car. When a breaks the window of the door the is entering through, the value will be set to .
If the glass is broken when a is about to open the 's door, the value immediately will be set to .
The is locked and must be broken into.
Even if the door the is entering through has its window broken, s will always have to try to break it and enter the consecutively.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleLockStatus.DriversSeatOnlyNoJacking

summary.para: s can only get in on the driver's seat normally only when the does not have a driver. Warping into the is the only way to make s get in on any other seat.
s cannot get any other s out of the to kill them.

member.remarks: Changing the 's lock status to this value does not immediately block s' entering vehicle tasks.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleLockStatus.IgnoredByPlayer
member.summary: Players cannot attempt to enter the with the enter vehicle key or button.

summary.para: The is locked and must be broken into even if already broken into (the same as ).
Doesn't allow players to exit the with the exit vehicle key or button.

member.name: P:GTA.VehicleWheel.WearMultiplier

summary.para: Gets or sets the value indicating how fast the tire will wear out. The higher this value is, the greater downforce will be created.
Only supported in v1.0.1868.0 and later versions. Will throw if the setter is called in earlier versions (the getter always returns in earlier versions).

member.remarks: This property represents the wear rate property SET_TYRE_WEAR_RATE is supposed to change, but Script Hook V does never call it and instead calls SET_TYRE_WEAR_RATE_SCALE in versions that support up to v1.0.2944.0 or some earlier game version (you can actually call SET_TYRE_WEAR_RATE in RAGE Plugin Hook and FiveM, and you can call GET_TYRE_WEAR_RATE in SHV scripts).
member.exception: Thrown when called on a game version prior to v1.0.1868.0.

member.name: P:GTA.VehicleWheel.MaxGripDiffFromWearRate

summary.para: Gets or sets the difference in tire grip. The more this value is, the more traction the wheel loses of traction produced from . Should be between a wear rate of 1 and 0.
Only supported in v1.0.2060.0 and later versions. Will throw if the setter is called in earlier versions (the getter always returns in earlier versions).

member.exception: Thrown when called on a game version prior to v1.0.2060.0.

member.name: P:GTA.VehicleWheel.WearRateScale

summary.para: Gets or sets the value indicating how fast the tires will wear out. Only affects how fast the tires will wear out and does not affect how strong the downforce will be.
Only supported in v1.0.2060.0 and later versions. Will throw if the setter is called in earlier versions (the getter always returns in earlier versions).

member.remarks: This property represents the wear rate scale property, which SET_TYRE_WEAR_RATE_SCALE is supposed to change, not the the wear rate property, which SET_TYRE_WEAR_RATE is supposed to change.
member.exception: Thrown when called on a game version prior to v1.0.2060.0.

member.name: M:GTA.Game.GenerateHash(System.String)
member.summary: Calculates a Jenkins One At A Time hash from the given which can then be used by any native function that takes a hash. Can be called in any thread.
member.param: The input to hash.
member.returns: The Jenkins hash of the input .
member.remarks: Converts ASCII uppercase characters to lowercase ones and backslash characters to slash ones before converting into a hash. Computes the hash from the substring between two double quotes if the first character is a double quote character.

member.name: M:GTA.Game.FindPattern(System.String,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Searches the address space of the current process for a memory pattern.
member.param: The pattern.
The address to start searching at. If (), search is started at the base address.
member.returns: The address of a region matching the pattern, or if none was found.
member.remarks: This function takes the Cheat Engine/IDA format ("48 8B 0D ?? ?? ? ? 44 8B C6 8B D5 8B D8" for example, where ?? and ? are wildcards).

member.name: M:GTA.Game.FindPattern(System.String,System.String,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Searches the address space of the current process for a memory pattern.
member.param: The pattern.
The pattern mask.
The address to start searching at. If (), search is started at the base address.
member.returns: The address of a region matching the pattern, or if none was found.
member.remarks: This function takes the classic format ("\x48\x8B\x0D\x00\x00\x00\x00\x44\x8B\xC6\x8B\xD5\x8B\xD8" as the pattern and "xxx????xxxxxxx" as the mask for example, where \x00 in the pattern and ? In the mask is a wildcard).

member.name: F:GTA.GameVersion.v1_0_757_3_Steam
member.remarks: The correct name would be v1_0_757_4_Steam since the Steam v1.0.757.3 does not exist but Steam v1.0.757.4 does. Script Hook V can log VER_1_0_757_4_STEAM in ScriptHookV.log but cannot log VER_1_0_757_3_STEAM as well.

member.name: F:GTA.GameVersion.v1_0_2372_0_NoSteam
member.summary: This value also represents the exe version 1.0.2372.2 for non-Steam version. 1.0.2372.2 basically works in the same way as 1.0.2372.0 but with bug fixes.

member.name: T:GTA.GameVersionNotSupportedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an invoked method is not supported in the running game version.
member.remarks:
indicates that no implementation exists for the running game version for an invoked method or property. There are two typical cases where a is thrown:
The relevant implementation is completely absent and operation cannot be performed in a meaningful way in the running game version. For example, cannot be implemented for the game versions earlier than v1.0.877.1 due to the absent of the member of restricted ammo count in CVehicle.
An invoked method or property calls a native function that does not exist in the running game version. In this case, some issues can be resolved with a custom wrapper implementation for earlier game version if relevant implementation is present.

member.name: T:GTA.GetSafePositionFlags
member.summary: An enumeration of the flags to be passed in to to govern which navmesh polygons it considers.
member.remarks: The test function that is used for this enum can be found with "75 07 32 C0 E9 88 00 00 00 F6 C1 04 74 0A 8B 42 24" (which is called via a function pointer). The test function uses the same struct layout as YnvPoly class in CodeWalker.

member.name: F:GTA.GetSafePositionFlags.OnlyPavement
member.summary: Only navmesh polygons marked as pavement.
member.remarks: The pavement flag is named B02_IsFootpath in CodeWalker30_dev44.

member.name: F:GTA.GetSafePositionFlags.NotIsolated
member.summary: Only navmesh polygons not marked as "isolated".
member.remarks: The isolated flag is named B15_InteractionUnk in CodeWalker30_dev44.

member.name: F:GTA.GetSafePositionFlags.NotInterior
member.summary: No navmesh polygons created from interiors.
member.remarks: The interior flag is named B14_IsInterior in CodeWalker30_dev44.

member.name: F:GTA.GetSafePositionFlags.NotWater
member.summary: No navmesh polygons marked as water.
member.remarks: The water flag is named B07_IsWater in CodeWalker30_dev44.

member.name: F:GTA.GetSafePositionFlags.OnlyNetworkSpawn
member.summary: Only navmesh polygons marked as "network spawn candidate".
member.remarks: The flag is named B17_IsFlatGround in CodeWalker30_dev44. Despite the name in the said CodeWalker build, some slope navmesh polygons has the "network spawn candidate" flag.

member.name: F:GTA.GetSafePositionFlags.UseFloodFill
member.summary: Specify whether to use a flood-fill from the starting position, as opposed to scanning all polygons within the search volume.

member.summary: Gets the jenkins-one-at-a-time hash.

member.name: T:GTA.Interior
member.summary: Represents a static class for general interior stuff.

member.name: M:GTA.Interior.CullExteriorObjectGeometryThisFrame(GTA.Model)
member.summary: Culls exterior objects from rendering (g-buffer only) by model hash this frame. This method is for use in multiplayer apartments which need to cull exterior shell of building etc.
member.remarks: The game can cull exterior geometries for up to 32 models at one frame. If the game already has 32 models to cull object geometries at this frame, the request will be ignored.

member.name: M:GTA.Interior.CullExteriorObjectShadowThisFrame(GTA.Model)

summary.para: Culls exterior objects from rendering (g-buffer only) by model hash this frame. This method is for use in multiplayer apartments which need to cull shadows of exterior shell of building etc.
Not available in the game versions prior to v1.0.757.2.

member.remarks: The game can cull shadows of exterior objects for up to 32 models at one frame. If the game already has 32 models to cull object geometries at this frame, the request will be ignored.
member.exception: Thrown if the method is called in one of the game versions prior to v1.0.757.2.

member.name: M:GTA.PathFind.RequestPathNodesInAreaThisFrame(GTA.Math.Vector2,GTA.Math.Vector2)

summary.para: Requests the path nodes in the given region to stream this frame.

This does not guarantee that the nodes will be loaded this frame. Therefore, you should keep calling this method for as long as you wish nodes to be present in the given area. If you stop calling this method, the nodes may be streamed out again at any time.

member.param: The minimum position of the region.
The maximum position of the region.
member.returns: if s are loaded for the region specified; otherwise, .

member.name: M:GTA.PathFind.SwitchPedPathsInArea(GTA.Math.Vector3,GTA.Math.Vector3,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Toggles ped paths in a cubic area. s will walk in areas that are switched on and new s will be generated on them. If a ped path is switched off, no s will be created on it and s that already exist will try to avoid walking through it. To revert to the original state, use .
member.param: The minimum position of the region.
The maximum position of the region.
Specifies whether ped nodes in area should be switched on or off. If , they will be switched on.

If , this method will avoid possible stalls by forcing any active pathfinding request to be aborted before switching ped navmeshes. Use this if there are reports of this method causing brief hangs waiting for navmesh data to be accessible, but be aware that if timing-critical pathfinding is occuring, that it can be interrupted by this.

member.name: M:GTA.PathFind.SetPedPathsBackToOriginal(GTA.Math.Vector3,GTA.Math.Vector3,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets all ped paths (navmeshes) in area back to their original state as per the map data and ynv files define.
member.param: The minimum position of the region.
The maximum position of the region.

If , this method will avoid possible stalls by forcing any active pathfinding request to be aborted before switching ped navmeshes. Use this if there are reports of this method causing brief hangs waiting for navmesh data to be accessible, but be aware that if timing-critical pathfinding is occuring, that it can be interrupted by this.

Specifies whether vehicle nodes in area should be switched on or off. If , they will be switched on.

member.summary: Start a shape test between 2 points calculated based on the mouse cursor position. Works just like only the start and end points of the probe are calculated based on the mouse cursor position projected into the world.
member.param: What type of objects the shape test should intersect with.
Specify an that the shape test should exclude, leave null for no entities ignored.
Specify options for the shape test.
member.value: The shape test handle and the start and end points of the probe are calculated based on the mouse cursor position projected into the world. If this method fails to create the shape test request because there are too many ongoing requests, will return on the handle struct.

member.name: T:GTA.ShapeTestHandle
member.summary: Represents a shape test handle. You need to call or every frame until one of the methods returns .

member.summary: Gets the native representation of this .

member.summary: Gets if the request of is failed. There is a limit to the number that can be in the system. Therefore, native functions for shape tests may fail to create the shapetest requests.
member.value: if the request is failed; otherwise, .

member.name: M:GTA.ShapeTestHandle.GetResult(GTA.ShapeTestResult@)
member.summary: If status returned is , then returns whether something was hit, and if so nearest hit position and normal. You need to call this method until the result is ready since the shape test result may not be finished in the same frame you start the shape test.
member.remarks: The shape test request is destroyed by this call if is returned. If this is not called every frame then the request will be destroyed.

member.name: M:GTA.ShapeTestHandle.GetResult
member.summary: If status returned is , then returns whether something was hit, and if so nearest hit position and normal. You need to call this method until the result is ready since the shape test result may not be finished in the same frame you start the shape test.
member.remarks: The shape test request is destroyed by this call if is returned. If this is not called every frame then the request will be destroyed.

member.name: M:GTA.ShapeTestHandle.GetResultIncludingMaterial(GTA.ShapeTestResult@,GTA.MaterialHash@)
member.summary: If status returned is , then returns whether something was hit, and if so nearest hit position, normal, and a hash of the material name. You need to call this method until the result is ready since the shape test result may not be finished in the same frame you start the shape test.
member.remarks: The shape test request is destroyed by this call if is returned. If this is not called every frame then the request will be destroyed.

member.name: M:GTA.ShapeTestHandle.GetResultIncludingMaterial

remarks.para: This functions the same as except this property returns a instead of an .
You should not expect the returned instance has meaningful position info as its matrix is set to most of the time.

member.returns: The if this is free aiming any ; otherwise,

member.name: P:GTA.Player.ClosestFreeAimTargetPos
member.summary: Gets the closest target position where this is free aiming at.
member.remarks:
Bullets and projectiles this shoot will go through this point. For projectiles, this applies only if the gravity is set to the default value.
The value will be the position the current asynchronous shape test yields if this is pressing this frame. The range how far the shape test will be tested depends on the WeaponRange value in the weapons.meta file. You should not use what this property returns as the exact crosshair target position, because the shape test for crosshair target processes asynchronously.
If is not pressing this frame, The value will be the position of the last asynchronous shape test result when this was pressing .
member.returns: The position where this is free aiming at.

member.name: P:GTA.Player.WantedLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the wanted level for this .

remarks.para: Will refocus the search area if you set a value less than the current value and is not zero.

Hardcoded to clamp to at most 5 since SET_PLAYER_WANTED_LEVEL just sets the pending crime value to zero when passed wanted level is a value other than from 1 to 5 (inclusive). Also, the game does not read WantedLevel6 items from dispatch.meta.

member.name: P:GTA.Player.WantedCenterPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the wanted center position for this .
member.value: The place in world coordinates where the police think this is.

member.name: P:GTA.Player.CurrentCrimeValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the current crime value that determines the real wanted level when the game updates the real wanted level.
member.remarks: For instance, if this value is 32 and a vehicle theft crime you started gets reported (increases by 18) without crime directly getting spotted by the police, this value will be 50 and the wanted level will be one when the game updates the real wanted level using this value.
member.value: The current crime value.

member.name: P:GTA.Player.NewCrimeValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the pending crime value that will be applied when the game ticks if is not zero and less than .
member.remarks: The game sets this value only when this commit a crime that will immediately increase their wanted level such as targeting a police officer, when SET_PLAYER_WANTED_LEVEL is called and the wanted level is to increase, or when the game applies this value to .
member.value: The pending crime value.

member.name: P:GTA.Player.TimeWhenNewCrimeValueTakesEffect
member.summary: Gets or sets the game time when will be set to . If zero, the game will not apply .
member.remarks: The game sets this value only when SET_PLAYER_WANTED_LEVEL is called and the wanted level is to increase or when the game applies to and set this value to zero.
member.value: The game time when will be set to .

member.name: P:GTA.Player.TimeSearchLastRefocused
member.summary: Gets or sets the last time when the search area got refocused for this . When you commit a crime that refocus the search area, this value will update.
member.remarks: The game will set this value to zero when the wanted level is zero.

member.name: P:GTA.Player.TimeLastSpotted
member.summary: Gets or sets the last game time when this is spotted by the police. The game will set this value to zero when the wanted level is zero.
member.remarks: The game will set to the game time as long as this is spotted by the police each frame, but you can make the getting in the hidden evasion phase up to 1 or 2 seconds if the police does not know where the is.

member.name: P:GTA.Player.TimeHiddenEvasionStarted
member.summary: Gets or sets the game time when hidden evasion phase gets started.
member.remarks: The game will set to zero when this is spotted by the police each frame, but you can set small value (but not zero) to clear the wanted level when the is in the hidden evasion phase if not suppressed by SUPPRESS_LOSING_WANTED_LEVEL_IF_HIDDEN_THIS_FRAME.

member.remarks: Only allows 1 instance of a movie active at one time, so you cannot create multiple instances for the same movie.

member.name: M:GTA.Scaleform.FromHandle(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a instance for the passed handle if it is valid.
member.param: The handle value. Should be between 1 and 20 since native functions for scaleform only accepts the values between 1 and 20 as scaleform handles (hardcoded limit).
member.returns: A instance if the passed handle is valid; otherwise, .
member.remarks: Strictly, this method returns a instance if the CGameScriptHandler for the SHVDN runtime has a CScriptResource_ScaleformMovie for the passed handle.

member.name: T:GTA.ScriptSound
member.summary: Represents a script sound, which is for audScriptSound. It is used for script audio sounds processed via the static audScriptAudioEntity instance.

member.name: P:GTA.ScriptSound.Id
member.summary: Gets the script sound id/index.

member.name: P:GTA.ScriptSound.IsNull
member.summary: Returns if the sound is negative, which indicates this is not valid.

members.member:
Plays back a sound with the name . If this is used to play a sound for which no pan or speakermask is set by the sound designer, then the sound will play from the map's origin - therefore this should only be used to play frontend sounds like menu bleeps or other artificially panned effects.
The sound name to play. The optional sound set name that contains the sound. .

member.name: M:GTA.ScriptSound.PlaySoundFrontend(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Plays back a sound "frontend" - at full volume, panned centrally.
member.param: The sound name to play.
The optional sound set name that contains the sound.

param.name: enableOnReplay
param.para: The name is taken from the official definition, but the effect is unknown.

Will be internally disabled if the hash calculated from (with ) is one of the values [0x5A23F3D5, 0xDF84A53C, 0xFD4C28, 0x832CAA0F, 0x17BD10F1, 0xFA4A5AA0, 0x2B8F97E3, 0x1D46A6A2, 0xF5E3A26A, 0xF35C567B, 0x71F56AB4, 0xC55C68A0, 0x54C522AD, 0xD382DF7C, 0x2A508F9C, 0xE8F24AFD, 0x8DDBFC96, 0x28C8633, 0x596B8EBB, 0x8A73028A, 0x578FE4D7, 0xE52306DE, 0x10109BEB].

member.remarks: If the sound has a Pan or a SpeakerMask set by the sound designer then the it will play using these settings, otherwise it will play from dead ahead (0).

member.name: M:GTA.ScriptSound.PlaySoundFromEntity(GTA.Entity,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Plays back a sound from an 's location. The sound's position will track the 's position as it moves.
member.param: The to play the sound from.
The sound name to play.
The optional sound set name that contains the sound.

member.name: M:GTA.ScriptSound.PlaySoundFromPosition(GTA.Math.Vector3,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Plays back a sound from an absolute position.
member.param: The world coordinates to play the sound from.
The sound name to play.
The optional sound set name that contains the sound.
If , the sound will use a portal occlusion environmentGroup. Only use this if the sound is playing outside and needs occlusion.

summary.para: Sets a variable on a sound.

This method allows to communicate with the sound engine in complex ways, by passing a floating point value to a specific sound object. This allows some nice effects such as adjusting the pitch of a sample being to be played back, or varying a lowpass cutoff. The VariableName parameter must be set up in RAVE (the audio scripting tool) as well as instruction on its usage on a case-by-case basis therefore a sound designer must be consulted with before using this command.

member.name: M:GTA.ScriptSound.UpdatePosition(GTA.Math.Vector3)
member.summary: Updates a playing sounds absolute position. Currently not available in v1.0.617.1 or earlier game versions.
member.param: The new position.

member.name: M:GTA.ScriptSound.Stop
member.summary: Stops a playing sound. Calling this method on this that has finished playing will have no ill effects in any case as long as the has not been released.

member.name: M:GTA.ScriptSound.Release
member.summary: Releases this . This should be called once a sound has finished being manipulated by the script so that its can be released and re-used.

member.name: M:GTA.Streaming.LoadScene(GTA.Math.Vector3)
member.summary: Synchronously loads a location (could be inside an interior, or not).

remarks.para: Stops an asynchronous load scene (CLoadScene) if there is an active one.
Since this method blocks the game until the location is loaded, the script may be terminated for timeout at the tick this method is executed.

member.name: P:GTA.Streaming.IsEnabled
member.summary: Sets the value that indicates whether the game will stream resources.

member.param: The coordinate point to stream extra collision and map resources.
member.remarks: Calling this method does not result in loaded collisions for weapon tests for bullets and projectiles around the specified point.

member.summary: Overrides the game focus and sets it to specified position and velocity The game focus is used for loading map data, collisions, object population etc. This method overrides it for the specified position and velocity.
member.param: The position in world space.
The velocity to use for & population in meters.

member.name: P:GTA.Streaming.FocusEntity

member.name: M:GTA.Streaming.IsEntityFocus(GTA.Entity)
member.summary: Returns if the specified is the current focus.

summary.para: Clears the overridden game focus and sets it to the player ped again (default).
The game focus is used for loading map data, collisions, object population etc. If this has been overridden by script, it is important to clear it afterwards.

member.name: M:GTA.Streaming.StartNewFrustumLoadScene(GTA.Math.Vector3,GTA.Math.Vector3,System.Single,GTA.NewLoadSceneFlags)
member.summary: Asynchronously loads a location (could be inside an interior, or not). Starts a new frustum load scene, which is interior-aware and uses a streaming volume.

The direction to stream for s and s (probably in meters). Should be non-zero.
The far clip.
The control flags.
member.returns: if load scene has started successfully; otherwise, .

remarks.para: You cannot use a new load scene during a player switch.
The game stops a load scene when SHVDN runtime terminates if it holds one for SHVDN script thread.

member.summary: Gets the value that indicates whether the global asynchronous load scene is currently running.
member.returns: if if an asynchronous load scene is active; otherwise, .

member.name: P:GTA.Streaming.IsNewLoadSceneLoaded
member.summary: Gets the value that indicates whether the global asynchronous load scene is fully loaded.
member.returns: if the global asynchronous load scene is active and fully loaded; otherwise, .
member.remarks: A new load scene is never guaranteed to eventually return if memory is under heavy load. Therefore, you might want to set up a custom timeout so you can do some alternative actions if new load scene is taking too long time to load a location.

member.name: T:GTA.StringHash
member.summary: A static class for jenkins-one-at-a-time hash methods, which is very robust for as a full 32-bit hash function and is heavily used by the game.

member.name: M:GTA.StringHash.AtPartialStringHash(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Partially computes a jenkins-one-at-a-time (joaat) hash as an from a that contains only ASCII characters. Does not finalize the hash. Uppercase letters and backslashes will be converted to lowercase letters and slashes respectively.
member.param: A that contains only ASCII characters.
The initial value when hashing starts.
member.returns: The partially calculated joaat hash.

remarks.para:
The following conversions will be performed before hashing the original string:
Map ASCII uppercase letters to lowercase.
Extract the substring within the first two double quotes if the first character/byte is a double quote (hashes to the end of sequence if there is only one double quote).
Convert backslashes to forward slashes so that the has is more useful for filenames.

This method only expects ASCII characters in . This is because the lookup table used by the joaat hash function used in GET_HASH_KEY expects only ASCII characters, and the table contains values for non-ASCII characters only to guarantee correctness even if "weird" european characters "sneak in" (are included in the string). If you need to pass a string that contains non-ASCII characters, use instead.

member.name: T:GTA.DrivingStyle
member.summary: An enumeration of frequently used driving styles. Consider using since it represents how flags affects how s should drive vehicles more accurately than this enumeration.

member.name: T:GTA.ParkType
member.summary: Set of enumerations of the available park types for .

member.name: T:GTA.VehicleChaseBehaviorFlags
member.summary: A set of flags to define how s should behave in vehicle chases.

member.name: T:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags
member.summary: A set of flags to define how s should drive vehicles.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.DontSteerAroundPlayerPed
member.summary: Don't steer around the player ped even if is set.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.GoOffRoadWhenAvoiding
member.summary: Make the prefer to go off the road rather than enter oncoming lanes when avoiding (steering around) obstacles if the correct lanes are full. Even if this value is set, the will try to steer around obstacles by entering other correct lanes if the correct lanes are not full.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.AllowGoingWrongWay
member.summary: Allow the to drive into the oncoming traffic if the correct lanes are full. Even if this value is set, the will try to reach the correct lanes again as soon as possible.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.UseWanderFallbackInsteadOfStraightLine
member.summary: If pathfinding fails, cruise randomly instead of going on a straight line.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.PreventBackgroundPathfinding
member.summary: Only works when the car mission is set to MISSION_CRUISE.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.AdjustCruiseSpeedBasedOnRoadSpeed
member.summary: Limit the speed based on the road speed if the max cruise speed for driving tasks exceeds the road speed. Only works when the car mission is set to MISSION_CRUISE.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.UseShortCutLinks
member.summary: Allow the to use short cut links (e.g. the 180? turns on the highways without the direction sign).

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.ChangeLanesAroundObstructions
member.summary: Make the driver change lanes around obstructions. Without this flag, even small obstacles make the driver completely change lanes.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.UseSwitchedOffNodes
member.summary: Allow the to drive on switched off nodes, which are usually located at paths whose colors on the map are darker than roads for driving (e.g. some dirt roads), and on parking lots. You can check if some nodes are marked as switched off with GET_VEHICLE_NODE_IS_SWITCHED_OFF.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.PreferNavmeshRoute
member.summary: Make prefer navigation mesh routes rather than vehicle nodes. Can be useful if you're going to be primarily driving off road.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.PlaneTaxiMode
member.summary: Only works for planes using MISSION_GOTO, will cause them to drive along the ground instead of fly.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.ForceStraightLine
member.summary: Force to go to the target directly instead of following the nodes regardless of the distance config for driving or vehicle mission tasks at which the ai switches to heading for the target directly.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.TryToAvoidHighways
member.summary: Avoid the highway unless the has to drive on it to achieve the vehicle task.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.DrivingModeStopForVehicles
member.summary: Standard driving mode. stops for cars, peds, and lights, goes around stationary obstructions, and obey lights.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.DrivingModeStopForVehiclesStrict
member.summary: Like , but doesn't steer around anything in its way - will only wait instead (doesn't deviate an inch).

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.DrivingModeAvoidVehicles
member.summary: Default "alerted" driving mode. Drives around everything, doesn't obey lights.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.DrivingModeAvoidVehiclesReckless
member.summary: Very erratic driving. difference between this and is that it doesn't use the brakes at ALL to help with steering.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.DrivingModePloughThrough
member.summary: Smashes through everything.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.DrivingModeStopForVehiclesIgnoreLights
member.summary: Drives normally except for the fact that it ignores lights.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.DrivingModeAvoidVehiclesObeyLights
member.summary: Try to swerve around everything, but stop for lights if necessary.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.DrivingModeAvoidVehiclesStopForPedsObeyLights
member.summary: Swerve around cars, be careful around peds, and stop for lights.

member.name: F:GTA.VehicleDrivingFlags.AvoidEmptyVehicles
member.summary: Use instead. Even with this flag set, the ped may avoid vehicles that have drivers when they are stationary.

member.name: T:GTA.VehicleEscortType
member.summary: Set of enumerations of the available vehicle escort types for .

member.name: T:GTA.VehiclePathNodePropertyFlags

member.name: F:GTA.VehiclePathNodePropertyFlags.OffRoad
member.summary: The node has been flagged as 'off road', suitable only for 4x4 vehicles, etc.

member.name: F:GTA.VehiclePathNodePropertyFlags.OnPlayersRoad
member.summary: The node has been dynamically marked as somewhere ahead, possibly on (or near to) the player's current road.

member.name: F:GTA.VehiclePathNodePropertyFlags.NoBigVehicles
member.summary: The node has been marked as not suitable for big vehicles.

member.name: F:GTA.VehiclePathNodePropertyFlags.SwitchedOff
member.summary: The node is switched off for ambient population.

member.name: F:GTA.VehiclePathNodePropertyFlags.LeadsToDeadEnd
member.summary: The node is, or leads to, a dead end.

member.name: F:GTA.VehiclePathNodePropertyFlags.Highway
member.remarks: Cannot be used with and takes precedence over this flag.

member.name: F:GTA.VehiclePathNodePropertyFlags.TrafficLight
member.remarks: Cannot be used with , because vehicle nodes can have either traffic-light or give-way feature as a special function but cannot have both of them.

member.name: F:GTA.VehiclePathNodePropertyFlags.GiveWay
member.remarks: Cannot be used with , because vehicle nodes can have either traffic-light or give-way feature as a special function but cannot have both of them.

member.name: F:GTA.VehiclePathNodePropertyFlags.Boat
member.remarks: Cannot be used with .

member.summary: Represents a collection of static methods about water.

member.name: M:GTA.Water.GetWaterLevel(GTA.Math.Vector3,System.Single@)
member.summary: Gets the level/height of the water below the position including the waves. This method takes the waves into account so the result may be different depending on the exact frame of calling.
member.returns: if successfully get the level/height of the water below the position; otherwise, .
member.remarks: This method gets the level of the water excluding the waves first, then adds the wave level delta if the method have successfully retrieve the level/height of the water. Therefore, this method returns when returns with the same arguments.

member.name: M:GTA.Water.GetWaterLevelNoWaves(GTA.Math.Vector3,System.Single@)
member.summary: Gets the height of the water below the position excluding the waves. This method does not take the waves into account so the result will be the same between different frames.

member.name: M:GTA.Water.TestLineAgainstWater(GTA.Math.Vector3,GTA.Math.Vector3,GTA.Math.Vector3@)
member.summary: Test a directed line probe against the water.
member.param: The start of the probe.
The end of the probe.
When this method returns, contains the intersection position on the water, the line probe hits water before hitting land. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: if the line probe hits water before hitting land; otherwise, .

member.name: P:GTA.World.WindSpeed
member.summary: Gets the current wind speed in m/s. The value is between 0 to 12.

member.name: P:GTA.World.WindSpeedOverride
member.summary: Sets the wind speed override by percentage, where 1.0 sets the current wind speed to 12.0 in m/s. Sets an negative value to stop using the override and let the game calculates the current wind speed as usual.
member.remarks: Although this property does not clamp the override value at all, the game clamps the wind speed between 0 and 12.0.

member.name: M:GTA.World.SetWindSpeedOverrideBySpeed(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the wind speed override by speed. The value divided by 12 will be set if the result is lower than 1.0. Otherwise, the value will be set to 1.0. Sets an negative value to stop using the override and let the game calculates the current wind speed as usual.
member.remarks: Basically do the same as does but with a upper bound and one division. Use to set the value precisely (and avoid one division for performance).

member.name: M:GTA.World.CreateRandomPed(GTA.Math.Vector3,System.Single,System.Func{GTA.Model,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Spawns a of a random at the position specified.
member.param: The position to spawn the at.
The heading of the .

param.name: predicate
param.para: The method that determines whether a model should be considered when choosing a random model for the . If is set, gangster and any animal models will not be chosen, including animals that do not swim or fly. Note that and `CREATE_RANDOM_PED` can pick a gangster and an animal model that do not swim or fly.

The default model prohibition was to imitate how `CREATE_RANDOM_PED` pick a ped model, but it turned out that the native does not filter out gang ped models or animal models that do not swim or fly after SHVDN v3.6.0 was released.

If , the pickup will be treated as a script object and persist until the SHVDN runtime terminates, or the pickup is marked as no longer needed.

member.summary: Clears non-mission s and cleans s and s within the defined sphere. All fires and explosions in the area are also cleared.
member.param: The center position.
The radius for area clearance.
If , all s in the area will also be cleared except for ones that are on s' hands or rocket s that are attached to rocket weapon s.
If , none of s generated by vehicle generators will be cleared even if they have been entered.
If , none of pickup s will get deleted except for low priority ones (although the exact condition is unknown).
member.remarks: Does not delete non-mission s that is protected by conditions other than . For example, this method does not delete the the player is in or automobiles (excluding amphibious or submarine cars), bikes, and helicopters (excluding blimps) in some garages. This method does not delete who are members of the player group as they are protected, either.

member.name: M:GTA.World.ShootSingleBulletIgnoreEntityNew(GTA.Math.Vector3,GTA.Math.Vector3,System.Int32,GTA.WeaponAsset,GTA.Ped,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Single,GTA.Entity,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,GTA.Entity,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fires an instant hit bullet between the two points or a projectile that goes toward taking into account an entity to ignore for damage.
member.param: Where the bullet or projectile is fired from.
Where the bullet is fired to. If the specifies a projectile weapon, the produced projectile will go in the direction of this parameter from .
The damage the bullet will cause. Must not be negative; otherwise, this method will not fire a bullet.

The weapon type to fire a bullet or projectile. You might want to request the asset and keep in memory unless you know the weapon info is already streamed, such as when has a weapon of this parameter hash. If the weapon info is not streamed, this method will not fire a bullet or projectile.
The owner who fires the bullet or projectile. Leaving will result in absent of owner of the produced bullet or projectile.
If , the bullet will go to the exact point where is. If , the method will apply a spread to the bullet.

If , the bullet trace visual effect will not be prevented from being created for not hitting an . Note that there are other conditions for where bullet comes from in both position and direction before bullet trace can be created (this parameter has no effect in these conditions).
If , is the player, and you are using a controller (pad), the controller can rumble/vibrate due to the corresponding CWeaponInfo setting.
The initial velocity for the produced projectile, leave -1 (or some negative value) for the default speed. Not used for bullets.

param.name: ignoreEntity
param.para: The who the bullet or projectile disable damage against. Must not be the same as , as the bullet will not collide with the owner or the the owner is in.
To prevent created projectiles from colliding with this , you need to set to (the bool parameter has no effect in the game versions earlier than v1.0.1103.2).

member.param: If , is set, and is a projectile weapon, this method will create a NEW projectile and don't use any equipped s from a weapon of .

Although this parameter name follows the canonical one bDisablePlayerCoverStartAdjustment, the actual effect is not known enough to describe (there is only one occurrence where this parameter is set to true out of all ysc scripts in v1.0.2944.0).

The who the produced rocket will home in. Must not be the same as or . Only used if is a rocket weapon and the homing flag is set in the corresponding CWeaponInfo data. For example, VEHICLE_WEAPON_SPACE_ROCKET and VEHICLE_WEAPON_PLANE_ROCKET can be used to home in. However, is not appropriate to home in using this method even though Homing flag is set in the CWeaponInfo data.
If and the game version is v1.0.1103.2 or later, the created projectile will freeze waiting for collision if absent.

param.name: ignoreCollisionEntity
param.para: If and the game version is v1.0.1103.2 or later, the created projectile will not collide with .
Cannot be used in conjunction with and takes precedence if both are set to and the game version is v1.0.2189.0 or later.

param.name: ignoreCollisionResetNoBB
param.para: If and if is inside the BoundingBox of , the created projectile will ignore collision until it leaves the BoundingBox.
Only available in the game version is v1.0.2189.0 or later. Cannot be used in conjunction with and this parameter takes precedence if both are set to .
